AD_DaisySpell.synopsis: In the fight against the Netherbrain and the Emperor, the Emperor brings Daisies to fight against players, based on their initial character creation choices. (Non-avatars get generic Daisies.)This AD is used by any Daisy as they use their charming spells.Drop: Make target drop their weapon.Grovel: Set a character prone.Flee: Make a character frightened.Halt: Cannot move or take actions.Hush: Silence.

GaleExplosion.synopsis: Gale ascends the stalk to the netherbrain, then sacrifices himself by unleashing the netherese orb and destroying the brain. Gale can be:Solo avatarSolo companionCompanion in company with the player (unleashing the orb as a final contingency once it seems they cannot win the fight)

AD_EnterPortal.synopsis: The portal to the Netherbrain's mind has been opened. Players must hurry to the portal and enter the mind arena ASAP.The first party member to take a turn will urge everyone to the portal.

AD_CrownTurn.synopsis: Plays during combat on top of brain in Netherbrain voice from the crown itself. Includes: AD for summoning the nautiloid, AD for dominating the dragon, generic ADs for every other turn.

AD_FirstMindTurn.synopsis: The party mindflayer has entered the mind arena where the Netherbrain's will (embodied by the smaller elder brain in chains) is nearly broken. This is the last statement the mindflayer character makes before fighting the brain in this last stretch.

FinalDecision.synopsis: Dialog in which you choose what you want to do with the Netherbrain after using Karsus' compulsion on it.Starts in Mental Arena, ends in sky above Baldur's Gate

AD_MindBrainTurn.synopsis: Dialog of the will of the netherbrain when fighting inside the main arena.WARNING: When destubbing, change the transition mode to WAIT FOR INPUT.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar.synopsis: Evil ending where the player determined to take the power of the netherbrain for themselves and betray Orpheus/Emperor/Illithid Karlach. In this case, the player is not dark urge (can be Dark Urge for Patch 6), and not an illithid themselves (handled elsewhere)
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar.how_to_trigger: loadlevel END_Mainoe mindbattleoe mindbraindieschoose to control the brain(or use debugbookwith Endgame Master Setup)

DestructionOfBrain.synopsis: Combat with the Netherbrain over, the player has dominated the brain and ordered it to self-destruct. The brain self-destructs, falling into the water (party along with it).

AD_KilledEmperor.synopsis: The players have started the final encounter against the Netherbrain. The Crown of Karsus is within sight.This is played on the first party member to act in the Netherbrain fight.The party may not have a mindflayer yet, in which case the person saying this AD needs to draw attention to the fact that the group should make use of the supreme tadpole in order to be able to dominate the brain.

CombatOver_SoloDurge.synopsis: Repeat of Dark Urge moment at the end of CombatOver for MP dark urges.

Intro.synopsis: Introduction to the last fight of the game against the Netherbrain. This dialog plays once the players enter the last combat arena, after the upper high hall escalade.Player climbs to the top of the Netherbrain. We see the Crown of Kharsus and realise that's where we need to cast the spell to dominate the brain. If the Emperor is against us, it appears, enthralled to the brain, and raises an army of daisies. If the Emperor is with us, the Netherbrain raises a bunch of super-thralls trained on our exact weaknesses.

FinalDecision_Nested_Kill.synopsis: Outcome of an evil ending option for the player to psionically command everyone to die.

FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest.synopsis: Final outcome of the avatar's evil ending, in which they've elected to set about conquering other worlds with their new forces.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave.synopsis: The githyanki have already departed on their red dragons. Lae’zel can join them or not if she’s present.Karlach leaves to die (in END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach). Towards the end of the dialogue, the party members wonder what to do next.JLatino: I believe Orpheus cannot appear in this sequence, he will always have departed. Looks like this can mostly take place on the pier.EXITS:END_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_WhatNextEND_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_ConclusionTerminus
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave.how_to_trigger: Dear cinematics team - we are really sorry for all the hardship we caused you but we wanted you to know we love you dearly and appreciate tremendously the way you bring our words to life. With love,The writing team

AD_FirstTurn.synopsis: The players have started the final encounter against the Netherbrain. The Crown of Karsus is within sight.This is played on the first party member to act in the Netherbrain fight.The party may not have a mindflayer yet, in which case the person saying this AD needs to draw attention to the fact that the group should make use of the supreme tadpole in order to be able to dominate the brain.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion.synopsis: JLatino: Deals with Avatar Astarion in the sun, Dark Urge might kill themself, Avatar Karlach wrap-up, companion Karlach is missing, Emperor present with Illithid Player.Would be good to start on a nuetral shot of folks walking back from the end of the pier.EXITS:Terminus

FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar.synopsis: Evil Ending if the player is a mind flayer and chooses to take control of the netherbrain. They can have been a mind flayer since the decision, or they could have turned into a mind flayer upon failing a saving throw in END_BrainBattle_FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar

AD_CrownBeingDominated.synopsis: The crown JUST got affected by the domination spell and says t his line.

AD_ProtectCaster.synopsis: The party mindflayer has begun casting Karsus' compulsion on the crown. The spell will take a turn to complete, and as such the mindflayer needs to be protected by other players.This AD will play on the player who takes a turn after the mindflayer starts the spellcast.

EnterMind.synopsis: Kharsus' Compulsion has completed, but the brain is taking one last stance to fight it. It will destroy the opportunity the spell has created. The players must make haste to enter the mind arena and defeat the brain once and for all.

CombatOver.synopsis: After the destruction of the brain, the survivors swim to shore (END_BrainBattle_DestructionOfBrain). Now, they take stock of their victory, and the burning city. While conversing, the githyanki depart on their red dragons. Lae’zel can join them or not if she’s present.Karlach leaves to die (in END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach). Towards the end of the dialogue, the party members wonder what to do next.
CombatOver.how_to_trigger: Dear cinematics team - we are really sorry for all the hardship we caused you but we wanted you to know we love you dearly and appreciate tremendously the way you bring our words to life. With love,The writing team

AD_EnemyEmperor.synopsis: The emperor is now an enemy under the Netherbrain's control. He serves as a central character of the last fight.This AD plays on the Emperor's turn. Extra lines are played once for when the party mindflayer uses Karsus' Compulsion on the crown and when the players are racing to get to the opened portal.

AD_HurryUp.synopsis: Some time has passed fighting the netherbrain, and the players still haven't started to dominate the brain. This AD serves to refocus the players, with increasing degrees of intensity.Will typically be played on COMPANIONS.Those companions can include emperor and orpheus. If none are available, there is a special version for the FULL_CEREMORPH  mindflayer to urge themselves onwards.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext.synopsis: JLatino: This is where creatures of the night: illithid player, emperor, and Astarion states are dealt with.Could likely start on the docks, would be nice to start them walking back to the warehouse area at Trunk Point to get a staging change into the scene.EXITS:END_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_ConclusionTerminus

AD_DaisySpell_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
AD_DaisySpell_0.text: Don't struggle - you are exactly where you wanted to be.
AD_DaisySpell_0.context: NodeContext: The point Daisy is making is akin to "You made your bed, now lie in it." Somewhere between soft and threatening.

AD_DaisySpell_1.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
AD_DaisySpell_1.text: Hush now. The time for talking is over.
AD_DaisySpell_1.context: NodeContext: gentle, coaxing (in a frightening way)

AD_DaisySpell_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
AD_DaisySpell_2.text: Why fight when you can run...
AD_DaisySpell_2.context: NodeContext: tapping into the player's fear - if the player is on the verge of running, this should be said with intent to tip them over the edge

AD_DaisySpell_3.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
AD_DaisySpell_3.text: Yield your trinkets and face me as you are!
AD_DaisySpell_3.context: NodeContext: with commanding power and authority

AD_DaisySpell_4.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
AD_DaisySpell_4.text: Drop to your knees and beg, thrall.

GaleExplosion_15.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_15.text: Up you go then, Gale. Best make this count... The whole world's watching.
GaleExplosion_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Companion Gale grabs onto the tentacle, and pauses, looking upwards. Pulses of mocking noise burst through his mind. After a moment, he shakes off the hesitiation and starts ascending, his expression resolute.NodeContext: Speaking to himself, urging himself on for the final confrontation. Occurs in a relatively secluded side room just before he ascends to the brain.

GaleExplosion_19.speaker: Elder Brain
GaleExplosion_19.text: Come to die? Come to kneel? Surrender and live - THRALL.

GaleExplosion_14.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_14.text: Thrall? No, I think you're mistaken. The name's Gale of Waterdeep. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.
GaleExplosion_14.context: NodeContext: Projecting. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout. Defiant and unfazed in the face of death. Line is a callback to how he first introduces himself

GaleExplosion_8.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_8.text: Though our time together will be exceptionally brief. Farewell, and happy landing.
GaleExplosion_8.context: NodeContext: Projecting. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout. Cheerful in the face of death (about to blow himself up to save the day)

GaleExplosion_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale smiles to himself, as if enjoying a private joke. A pulsing glow of netherese magic flares from his chest, growing more intense with each heartbeat. Gale closes his eyes serenely as the magic overcomes him. The netherbrain utters a fearful SFX screech as the whole screen is engulfed.

GaleExplosion_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: A poignant shot of Elminster witnessing Gale's explosion from afar.

GaleExplosion_23.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_23.text: We've tried our very best, but it seems victory is beyond our grasp, I'm sad to say.
GaleExplosion_23.context: NodeContext: Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner to a comrade. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout. 'We tried, but I don't think we're going to win this fight'

GaleExplosion_20.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_20.text: At least, victory in which we live to tell the tale.
GaleExplosion_20.context: NodeContext: Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner to a comrade. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout. Referring to the orb - he can destroy the brain, but the party will die

GaleExplosion_4.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_4.text: Don't worry - I'll handle matters from here. And gods willing, there'll be plenty of folk left to tell our tale after we're gone.
GaleExplosion_4.context: NodeContext: reassuring. Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner to a comrade. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout.

GaleExplosion_26.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_26.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Speaking to a lover. Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout.

GaleExplosion_12.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_12.context: NodeContext: sincere. Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner to a comrade. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout.

GaleExplosion_18.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_18.text: It has. And a pleasure, a privilege, a tale for the ages, and if I'm being honest... the very best time I've had in my entire life.
GaleExplosion_18.context: NodeContext: Sincere, lots of camaraderie. Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner to a comrade. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout.

GaleExplosion_1.speaker: Player
GaleExplosion_1.text: We might still have a chance.

GaleExplosion_11.speaker: Gale
GaleExplosion_11.text: This is our chance. Close your eyes. You'll be wherever you want to be in but a moment.
GaleExplosion_11.context: NodeContext: Reassuring. Projecting some, but still speaking in a heartfelt manner to a comrade. Atop a huge brain floating high above the city, battles raging throughout.

GaleExplosion_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: A pulsing glow of netherese magic flares from Gale's chest, growing more intense with each heartbeat. He closes his eyes serenely as the magic overcomes him, then the other party members. The netherbrain utters a fearful SFX screech as the whole screen is engulfed.

GaleExplosion_29.speaker: Narrator
GaleExplosion_29.text: *The end awaits. The last sights you'll ever see. The last words you'll ever utter. The last action you'll ever take... Best make them count.*
GaleExplosion_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale grabs onto the tentacle, and pauses, looking upwards. Pulses of mocking noise burst through his mind. After a moment, he shakes off the hesitiation and starts ascending, his expression resolute.

GaleExplosion_7.speaker: Player
GaleExplosion_7.text: Thrall? No, I think you're mistaken. The name's Gale of Waterdeep. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.

GaleExplosion_24.speaker: Player
GaleExplosion_24.text: And smear my knees with your brain gunk? I think not.

GaleExplosion_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale smiles to himself, as if enjoying a private joke. A pulsing glow of netherese magic flares from his chest, growing more intense with each heartbeat. Gale closes his eyes serenely as the magic overcomes him. The netherbrain utters a fearful SFX screech as the whole screen is engulfed.

GaleExplosion_27.speaker: Player
GaleExplosion_27.text: It doesn't even deserve a response. Just think of those you care about, and unleash your power.

AD_EnterPortal_0.speaker: Player
AD_EnterPortal_0.text: A crack in its defences! Now we can destroy its true self.
AD_EnterPortal_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_EnterPortal_1.speaker: Orpheus
AD_EnterPortal_1.text: That's it - we've penetrated its defences. Now let's confront its true self.
AD_EnterPortal_1.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_EnterPortal_2.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EnterPortal_2.text: That's it - we've penetrated its defences. Now let's confront its true self.
AD_EnterPortal_2.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_CrownTurn_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownTurn_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_CrownTurn_1.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownTurn_1.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_CrownTurn_2.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownTurn_2.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_CrownTurn_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownTurn_3.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_CrownTurn_4.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownTurn_4.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_CrownTurn_5.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownTurn_5.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstMindTurn_0.speaker: Player
AD_FirstMindTurn_0.text: This is it - its will is weakening!
AD_FirstMindTurn_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstMindTurn_1.speaker: The Emperor
AD_FirstMindTurn_1.text: This is it - its will is weakening.
AD_FirstMindTurn_1.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstMindTurn_2.speaker: Orpheus
AD_FirstMindTurn_2.text: Its will is weakening - the brain is almost defeated!
AD_FirstMindTurn_2.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

FinalDecision_40.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_40.text: Subdued. At last. This is its death rattle.

FinalDecision_140.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_140.text: This is it, soldier. This is what we fought for.

FinalDecision_84.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_84.text: *The brain is on the cusp of its final thought. And it's taking all of Karlach's strength to keep it there. An opportunity, perhaps?*

FinalDecision_81.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_81.text: *You glimpse the life-long destiny promised by your Father. Enslave. Dominate. Ruin.*

FinalDecision_103.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_103.text: *In your Father's name, you must seize your rightful claim to the brain, not destroy it.*

FinalDecision_36.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_36.text: *If you do not, then he will flay and shred your mind, so it cannot even comprehend the horrors he will plague you with.*

FinalDecision_12.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_12.text: This is the moment, my love. The moment in which we make a new world for ourselves.

FinalDecision_98.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_98.text: It can be ours, my love. The whole world - we only have to take it.

FinalDecision_32.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_32.text: I know what you're thinking. So let's do it. Let's seize the whole damn world and be reviled together.

FinalDecision_94.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_94.text: We could do it, you know. We could rule the world.

FinalDecision_66.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_66.text: *You glimpse a future where you lose all the gifts the parasite gave you - a future where you no longer see the sun.*

FinalDecision_118.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_118.text: Defy your Father. Command the brain to destroy the tadpoles and then itself.

FinalDecision_24.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_24.text: Defy your Father. Tell the Emperor to command the brain to die.

FinalDecision_28.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_28.text: Defy your Father. Tell Karlach to command the brain to destroy itself.

FinalDecision_72.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_72.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal.

FinalDecision_76.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_76.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal. Kill the Emperor.

FinalDecision_19.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_19.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal. Kill Orpheus.

FinalDecision_48.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_48.text: Claim the Absolute in the name of Bhaal. Betray Karlach.

FinalDecision_157.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_157.text: Implore the Emperor to dominate the brain and rule the world, with you by his side.

FinalDecision_61.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_61.text: I admire the ambition. The thought did cross my mind.

FinalDecision_143.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_143.text: But whoever becomes the Absolute faces a war with the entire githyanki army.

FinalDecision_16.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_16.text: Strong as we are, they are legion. I cannot be sure of survival.

FinalDecision_102.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_102.text: You're right - just kill the brain.

FinalDecision_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor gives player a nod, and turns towards the brain.

FinalDecision_85.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: If possible, the brain closes its eyes as these lines are spoken. The mind arena begins to dim, and the face eventually fades into the darkness. Then a flash of bright light as players transition back into the real world, atop the brain, in the CombatOver dialogue.

FinalDecision_39.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_39.text: We can do it. I believe in us.

FinalDecision_9.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_9.text: You have grown much. I'm proud of you.

FinalDecision_51.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_51.text: Your faith in our bond is touching. But we did not come this far only to lose the fight for our survival at the final hurdle.

FinalDecision_31.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_31.text: The brain will die. We will have our freedom.

FinalDecision_108.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_108.text: We've already killed their Prince - may as well finish what we started.

FinalDecision_10.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_10.text: We destroyed an entire githyanki crèche didn't we?

FinalDecision_134.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_134.context: NodeContext: He ponders for a moment, before speaking, and when he speaks, it's decisive

FinalDecision_29.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

FinalDecision_35.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player gestures and a burst of absolute energy from the ground of the mental arena, the vfx wipe the screen and reveal the player has returned to the top of the Netherbrain above the city of Baldur's Gate.

Behind the player a throne of brain matter emerges from the Netherbrain and the player seats themself upon it.

FinalDecision_77.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Dragons and Nautiloids still fight around the the skies of Baldur's Gate.

The player closes their eyes focusing.

Arcs of electricity sprout from the base of the throne across the massive zepplin-like form of the Netherbrain. Energy is built up, until a shockwave is released.

As the dragons are caught in blast, they fall from the sky to the streets below, breathing their last licks of remaining fire.

FinalDecision_173.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cut to the Emperor seated on a throne atop the brain, with full-illithid versions of the avatar and half-illithid versions of surviving companions standing on either side of them, chanting 'FOR THE ABSOLUTE' in the voice of the brain itself.

All are enthralled to the Emperor.

FinalDecision_11.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the Emperor's face. They smile. Close up on the player standing just behind them, a mind flayer, and a thrall of the Emperor.

FinalDecision_135.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

FinalDecision_95.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_95.text: Your commitment to completion is endearing. But you risk too much. We did not come this far only to lose the fight for our survival at the final hurdle.

FinalDecision_96.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_96.text: Go ahead. Command the brain to destroy all tadpoles and then itself.

FinalDecision_119.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_119.text: Command the brain to destroy the tadpoles and then itself.

FinalDecision_87.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_87.text: Go ahead, Karlach. This moment's yours.

FinalDecision_128.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_128.text: No more tadpoles, brain. It's time to die.

FinalDecision_56.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_56.text: Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute. Conquer the world.

FinalDecision_162.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Emperor with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Emperor's dead body. 

Should be psionic,

FinalDecision_161.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Orpheus with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Orpheus' dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

FinalDecision_145.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Karlach mind flayer with a smirk, and slaughters her. Player picks up Netherstones from her dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

FinalDecision_178.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Emperor with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Emperor's dead body. 

Should be psionic,

FinalDecision_156.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Orpheus with a smirk, and slaughters him. Player picks up Netherstones from Orpheus' dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

FinalDecision_47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to Karlach mind flayer with a smirk, and slaughters her. Player picks up Netherstones from her dead body. 

Should be a psionic attack.

FinalDecision_45.speaker: Lae'zel
FinalDecision_45.text: Shka'keth! What do you think you're doing?
FinalDecision_45.context: NodeContext: Panicking. Shkaketh = You asshole! = SHKA-keth. Kshar'lak = Traitor = h-SHAR-lahk.

FinalDecision_137.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_137.text: What I was born to do.

FinalDecision_106.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_106.text: You are glorious, my love. You have never been more beautiful.

FinalDecision_33.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player as mind flayer hovers towards the brain.

FinalDecision_166.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Apart from Minthara, who stands closer to the player, the companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen. Minthara is spared,

CinematicNodeContext: Apart from Minthara, who stands closer to the player, the companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen. Astarion is spared.

FinalDecision_142.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player's companions look on horrified. The black fog of the mindmelds and absolutes scenes flow from the player.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen.

The companions struggle to stand in the presence of the New Absolute. Their squints turn into blinks, which reveal their eyes have changed to glow mind flayer orange. Their movements calm, as the black fog dissipates.

The player makes a fist and off screen we hear the sounds of the companions transforming into illithids off-screen.

FinalDecision_71.context:

Behind the player a throne of brain matter emerges from the Netherbrain and the player seats themself upon it.

CinematicNodeContext: Dragons and Nautiloids still fight around the the skies of Baldur's Gate.

The player closes their eyes focusing.

Arcs of electricity sprout from the base of the throne across the massive zepplin-like form of the Netherbrain. Energy is built up, until a shockwave is released.

As the dragons are caught in blast, they fall from the sky to the streets below, breathing their last licks of remaining fire.

FinalDecision_180.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cut to the avatar seated on a throne atop the brain, with half-illithid versions of their surviving companions standing on either side of them, chanting 'FOR THE ABSOLUTE' in the voice of the brain itself.

They are companions no more, merely the thralls closest to the player.

FinalDecision_83.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

FinalDecision_41.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

FinalDecision_43.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

FinalDecision_91.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the avatar's face (the one who made the final decision). They smile.NodeContext: With a smile - you're a god now

FinalDecision_132.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player as mind flayer hovers towards the brain.

FinalDecision_70.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_70.text: I'm doing what I planned to do from the beginning - taking control.

FinalDecision_38.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

FinalDecision_30.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and player mind flayer hover toward the brain together.

FinalDecision_86.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_86.text: I'm doing what I planned to do from the beginning - taking control.

FinalDecision_171.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_171.text: Don't worry - you're still part of my design.

FinalDecision_44.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_44.text: Stop - STOP! What are you doing?!

FinalDecision_4.speaker: Jaheira
FinalDecision_4.text: Malar's mark, what are you DOING?
FinalDecision_4.context: NodeContext: mal-AHR - swear word, incredulous anger / fear - player is betraying us at the end.

FinalDecision_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_6.context: InternalNodeContext: This inclusion only if Astarion did not previously encourage the player to choose an evil ending.

FinalDecision_69.speaker: Wyll
FinalDecision_69.text: No no no. By the Nine Circles, what are you doing?

FinalDecision_127.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_127.text: What in all the sweet hells are you doing?!
FinalDecision_127.context: InternalNodeContext: This inclusion only if Astarion did not previously encourage the player to choose an evil ending.

FinalDecision_163.speaker: Minsc
FinalDecision_163.text: NO! We will NOT let this come to pass!

FinalDecision_164.speaker: Halsin
FinalDecision_164.text: No! Cease now, before you doom us all!

FinalDecision_17.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_17.text: Betray Karlach. Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute.

FinalDecision_154.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player advances towards Karlach threateningly.

FinalDecision_3.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_3.text: Betray the Emperor. Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute.

FinalDecision_90.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_90.text: Betray Orpheus. Dominate the brain. Become the Absolute.

FinalDecision_165.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_165.text: *Your Father's expectation feels like a noose around your neck. Now is the moment to dominate the world in his name.*

FinalDecision_18.speaker: Orpheus
FinalDecision_18.text: There. At last. It is subdued.

FinalDecision_124.speaker: Orpheus
FinalDecision_124.text: And thus I honour my mother's legacy. The Grand Design, once again, ended by my line.

FinalDecision_53.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_53.text: *The brain is on the cusp of its final thought. And it's taking all of Orpheus' strength to keep it there. An opportunity perhaps?*

FinalDecision_136.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
FinalDecision_136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player has beaten the the smaller smackable brain (the brain without a face) away, and we're left face to face with the big brain with a ginormous face, which is ready to plead for its life.

FinalDecision_73.speaker: Lae'zel
FinalDecision_73.text: Silence, brain! The Grand Design has failed. You have failed!
FinalDecision_73.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the netherbrain

FinalDecision_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_14.text: It is afraid - good. Show no mercy.
FinalDecision_14.context: NodeContext: sadistic pleasure mixed with relief - this is the end, and the final enemy (the netherbrain) has surrendered

FinalDecision_7.speaker: Jaheira
FinalDecision_7.text: The bleating of a predator turned suddenly prey. Do not listen.
FinalDecision_7.context: NodeContext: Firm, mercliess as the Brain begs us to spare it

FinalDecision_79.speaker: Lae'zel
FinalDecision_79.text: Command it to die. End this.

FinalDecision_62.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_62.text: This is it. You have to command it to die!

FinalDecision_5.speaker: Jaheira
FinalDecision_5.text: There is only one order to give. 'Die'.
FinalDecision_5.context: NodeContext: firm and merciless as the brain makes us promises.

FinalDecision_46.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_46.text: We are giving the orders now - command it to obey! Seize control!
FinalDecision_46.context: NodeContext: sadistic and triumphant - the final enemy has surrendered, and her vegeance has come at last

FinalDecision_107.speaker: Wyll
FinalDecision_107.text: You know what to do. Kill the godsdamned thing.

FinalDecision_133.speaker: Shadowheart
FinalDecision_133.text: Order it to die! Do it now, before it's too late!

FinalDecision_153.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_153.text: All right, it's time. Let's end this.
FinalDecision_153.context: NodeContext: a little sad, he's about to give up the ability to walk in the sun

FinalDecision_170.speaker: Minsc
FinalDecision_170.text: Tell it to split its own seams - end this!
FinalDecision_170.context: NodeContext: Sharp, merciless - telling us to order the netherbrain to destroy itself

FinalDecision_181.speaker: Halsin
FinalDecision_181.text: Command it to die! It must be now!
FinalDecision_181.context: NodeContext: Urgent cry during climactic battle

FinalDecision_104.speaker: Wyll
FinalDecision_104.text: Shut it out. Let it die.

FinalDecision_111.speaker: Shadowheart
FinalDecision_111.text: Don't listen! It'll try any trick in order to survive!

FinalDecision_125.speaker: Gale
FinalDecision_125.text: Ignore it. Nothing but a vile death rattle.

FinalDecision_150.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_150.text: Shut it out. It's on the precipice - push it over.

FinalDecision_167.speaker: Minsc
FinalDecision_167.text: No! NO more listening to brains!
FinalDecision_167.context: NodeContext: Sharp, not having any of it

FinalDecision_174.speaker: Halsin
FinalDecision_174.text: The end is upon us - ignore the brain's pleas. It must die!
FinalDecision_174.context: NodeContext: Urgent cry during climactic battle

FinalDecision_54.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_54.text: It knows this is the end of the road. Pay it no mind.

FinalDecision_175.speaker: Orpheus
FinalDecision_175.text: There. At last. It is subdued.

FinalDecision_114.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_114.text: Subdued at last - it begs for its life.

FinalDecision_148.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_148.text: Subdued at last - it begs for its life.

FinalDecision_115.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_115.text: It pleads because it knows I am its master. I will finish this.

FinalDecision_8.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_8.text: *The brain is on the cusp of its final thought. And it's taking all of the Emperor's strength to keep it there. An opportunity perhaps?*

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Big sound of explosion. Reuse any shots of party looking up at burning city that we can. (It's burning from previous attacks by nautiloids and dragons, not from Gale's explosion.)InternalNodeContext: This picks up from END_BrainBattle_GaleExplosion where Gale blows himself up on top of the brain after having teleported the party to safety.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_24.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_24.text: He succeeded. He destroyed the Netherbrain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_4.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_4.text: ...The parasite. It's withered, dead along with the Netherbrain. I am cleansed! I will never be a filthy ghaik.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_14.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_14.text: He sacrificed his life for everyone. He may not have been a warrior, but he fought better than any of us.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_12.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_12.text: Even when my time in the Prism stretched out like eternity - when escape seemed impossible - I never lost hope.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_13.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_13.text: I will ensure that all githyanki know his name - and his sacrifice. What he has done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_50.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_50.text: With their lost Prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to Gale - the wizard who destroyed a Netherbrain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_45.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_45.text: It seems that your sacrifice was not needed. Nonetheless, I hope you enjoy your newly uncovered potential.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_38.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_38.text: We have achieved all that I desired. Thanks to Gale, we are free.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_53.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_53.text: All that wisdom, lost, forever. All so that we could survive. I owe him my life. We all do.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_20.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_20.text: Strange... I miss him. More than I thought I would.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_6.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_6.text: The city must remember him. Not just for his triumph, but for his courage.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_55.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_55.text: He's a hero. A fucking hero.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_11.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_11.text: May he find the rest he deserves. Such an act will be remembered. And in its memory, he will live on.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_7.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_7.text: Gale was many things - but he was a hero, at the very end. That is how he ought to be remembered.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_8.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_8.text: Boo will raise a statue in Gale's name. It will be the size of a planet to honour the size of Gale's courage.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_25.text: He recognised he was the least of us, and spent his life to ensure our survival. That showed wisdom.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_36.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_36.text: But we'll never forget him. And neither will the city he saved.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_34.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_34.text: Of course, it did cost us a wizard. But - well, it was his choice.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_48.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_48.text: Of course, it did cost us a wizard. Poor Gale.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_22.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_22.text: But Gale... I can't believe he's gone.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_28.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_28.text: Gale gave his life for us, for everyone... and now he's gone.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_10.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_10.text: We prevailed, but only thanks to Gale.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_44.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_44.text: The wizard didn't live to see himself cured. He gave his life for everyone else.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_17.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_17.text: Boo will be sad for Gale. He was the best wizard Boo ever knew. The only wizard close to Boo's power.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_57.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_57.text: All it cost was a single wizard.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_60.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_60.text: And all it cost was our friend.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_40.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_40.text: I can't feel the tadpole... they must have all died in the explosion - that means I can't turn into a mind flayer!

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_2.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_2.text: The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_54.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_54.text: The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. Thanks to that bomb of his, we're not going to turn into mind flayers!

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_19.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_19.text: I can't feel the tadpole. By the Triad, we're cleansed - we will never be mind flayers!

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_37.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_37.text: The tadpoles must have died with the brain in the explosion. The threat of ceremorphosis is no more.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_1.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_1.text: And the tadpoles have fallen silent, I take it? Good.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_42.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_42.text: And the worm squirms no more! Boo need not worry that his seat on my skull will grow suddenly stickier with mind flayer juice.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_33.text: And we are cleansed. The tadpoles are still, at last.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_51.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_51.text: He did it, he actually did it... he blew up the brain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_43.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_43.text: The wizard did it... he really did it. He blew up the brain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_31.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_31.text: Gale... he did it, he really did it. The Netherbrain is defeated.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_18.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_18.text: He did it... he actually did it... he blew up the Netherbrain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_0.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_0.text: He succeeded. The Netherbrain is defeated.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_27.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_27.text: That wizard took a risk, and it looks like it paid off. The brain is destroyed.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_39.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_39.text: Boo wants to reassure you that the boom was not him. It was the sound of Gale blowing up the brain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_58.text: It seems the wizard kept his nerve. He destroyed the brain.

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_59.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_59.text: *The brain is gone, and with it, the legions of tadpoles that it spawned. There will be no Grand Design, no domination, no enslaving of the land.*

CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_29.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_GaleExplodedIntro_29.text: *And it's all thanks to Gale, the wizard who saved Baldur's Gate.*

AD_MindBrainTurn_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
AD_MindBrainTurn_3.text: It will not be broken by you.

CombatOver_Nested_GithAreLeaving_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Githyanki and dragons leave]
The dragons start to port out back to the Astral Plane.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is seated on their throne atop the Netherbrain after having seized control. Their companions, if present, stand nearby, enthralled/dominated.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_88.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_88.text: *The world is yours. All who still draw breath bow to you. Your authority is unmatched. Your power is... Absolute.*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands and gazes down at the city. Psionic energy pulsates from them, like a signal. The Netherbrain starts to descend.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_37.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Down on street level. Various Baldurians cower or stand ready to defend themselves from Mind Flayers. They grimace, awaiting the final assault... 

... but it does not come. The Mind Flayers no longer attack, but keep the survivors surrounded, watching and waiting.

The Baldurians look up in terror and awe as a huge shadow falls.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The source of the shadow - the Netherbrain - descends towards the streets, blotting out the sun. Baldurians cringe in fear.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_100.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Netherbrain's descent slows as it nears street level. Damaged buildings tremble, and a great cloud of dust fills the air. The watching Mind Flayers part ranks. From the dust cloud -

- The Enthralled Companions stride forth. They clear a path to the Baldurians like an honour guard. A final figure floats downwards as the dust settles. The Player. Psionics pulse outwards from the player. All those around them, including Enthralled Companions, kneel. All save for Love Interest Minthara, if present. She approaches the player's side.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_13.text: See how they kneel to us? We are their protectors, their salvation,  and we will rule them, together.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_15.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_15.text: The taste of conquest lingers on your lips. Fear not, my love - soon we will savour it again.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player steps away from their love interest walks amongst the masses.They look around, considering what to do next...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_80.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_80.text: *You have come so far. Once, you feared ceremorphosis, but no more. It has granted you ultimate power, and now ushers your dreams towards reality...*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_27.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_27.text: *But such power has a price, and yours are not the only dreams. You feel compelled to follow the will of the illithid hivemind. To enact the Grand Design.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_25.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_25.text: *Your willpower prevails. You remain in control. If the Grand Design is to unfold, it shall only do so at your command. But it is not the only choice that tempts you...*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_29.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_29.text: *It's no use - you feel control slipping away. The Grand Design shall not be denied.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_31.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_31.text: Your choices brought you to this moment. Accept your part in the Grand Design.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_36.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_36.text: *You cede control. It's almost comforting, to be part of something far grander than any individual. You are the crest of a great wave that will consume all, and redefine all.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_33.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_33.text: *... or so it would have been, had you not indulged too often in the power that the illithids provided. Now the scales demand to be balanced. Ceremorphosis beckons...*
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is suddenly gripped by pain, hunching over. They gasp and clutch at their breast.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_38.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_38.text: Resist. You are in control, not the parasites.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grimaces in concentration and wills the ceremorphosis away (may need some vfx to sell this, otherwise it may look like indigestion). They straighten back up, calm and in control.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_17.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_17.text: *Luckily, the illithid powers were but one aspect of your might. You remain in control, now and always. Time to exercise your will.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player succumbs to ceremorphosis (dealer's choice as to how this is handled/how much is shown - perhaps it can largely play off-screen with sound FX while onlookers watch). The player straightens, looking at their transformed hand. Illithid armour magically materialises upon them.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_57.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_57.text: Your choices brought you here. Accept your fate and succumb to ceremorphosis.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_91.speaker: The Emperor
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_91.text: *Bhaal shall not be sated until you are the last creature living. The Gate is the eye of your extinction, then Amn, then Waterdeep, all the way to the damned Spine of the World.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_85.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_85.text: *You have come so far. Once you wished for nothing more than to survive, but now your dreams are far grander. By your hand alone, the future of all things shall be determined.*

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_65.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_65.text: You destroyed one god. It's time the rest of the heavens shared in the Absolute's fate.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_50.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_50.text: Infuse yourself with the power of the Absolute - become the ruler you were destined to be.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_95.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_95.text: I shall rule like no other has before me, as the great unifier, wise leader, and final judge.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_52.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_52.text: With this power, I shall conquer Tu'narath. Queen Vlaakith's reign enters its final days.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_77.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_77.text: All my life, I've been caught between two warring goddesses. Time to plot a new course.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_73.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_73.text: Fuck Baldur's Gate. Fuck Avernus. They're mine now.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_8.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_8.text: This is just the beginning. More worlds shall fall to you.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_0.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_0.text: The city shall become a monument to your glory. Rebuilt by your adoring subjects.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_60.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_60.text: There can be no future for such sheep. Will them all to die.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_99.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_99.text: You do not wish to rule. You wish for the fires of chaos to consume all.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_55.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_55.text: Remove the tadpole at last and depart with your companions.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches towards their eye socket. Onlookers gasp, reacting to a tadpole extraction (show as much or as little of the extraction as you see fit). The player considers the tadpole in their palm with a thoughtful 'so this is what caused  all the fuss' expression. Expression then hardens and the tadpole combusts in their palm. They drop embers to the ground, satisfied.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player turns to leave. Companions nod their assent and exit frame (implication that they're joining you/leaving first)

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_51.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_51.text: Rid yourself of the parasite at last and walk away from all of this - alone.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_44.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_44.text: Rid yourself of the parasite at last and walk away from all of this.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to leave.  Companions react, crestallen

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turns to leave. alone

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_64.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_64.text: Force Minthara to kneel along with the rest. All bow to you now.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player's psionics pummel Minthara. She  just about manages to force a look of shock and betrayal onto their face before they are forced onto their knees in supplication.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_16.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Netherbrain's descent slows as it nears street level. Damaged buildings tremble, and a great cloud of dust fills the air. The watching Mind Flayers part ranks. From the dust cloud -

- The Enthralled Companions stride forth. They clear a path to the Baldurians like an honour guard. A final figure floats downwards as the dust settles. The Player. Psionics pulse outwards from the player. All those around them, including Enthralled Companions, kneel. All save for Love Interest Astarion, if present. He approaches the player's side.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_63.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_63.text: Well, my love, we did it. This world is ours, as it should be.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_4.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_4.text: I always knew you could do it. I always knew that together, we could do anything.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_26.speaker: Player
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_26.text: 'Ours'? Force Astarion to kneel along with the rest. All bow to you now.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_94.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_94.text: No, what are you doing? I won't - you can't... No... Please...
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player's psionics pummel Astarion. He just about manages to force a look of shock and betrayal onto his face before he's forced onto his knees in supplication.

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_23.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Netherbrain's descent slows as it nears street level. Damaged buildings tremble, and a great cloud of dust fills the air. The watching Mind Flayers part ranks. From the dust cloud -

- The Enthralled Companions stride forth. They clear a path to the Baldurians like an honour guard. A final figure floats downwards as the dust settles. The Player. Psionics pulse outwards from the player. All those around them, including Enthralled Companions, kneel

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_34.speaker: Lae'zel
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_34.text: The power to raise or ruin empires lies with you now. But how shall you wield it?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_18.speaker: Karlach
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_18.text: It's yours, soldier. Ultimate power. What will you do?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_1.speaker: Jaheira
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_1.text: At last. The power to tame or break the world is yours. Where will you begin?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks amongst the masses (all kneeling/no love interest standing) They look around, considering what to do next...

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_10.text: The world awaits your command. What is it to be?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_46.speaker: Wyll
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_46.text: Your power reaches to the horizon and beyond now. How do you intend to wield it?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_69.speaker: Shadowheart
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_69.text: So much power... no one can resist you now. But what comes next?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_74.speaker: Gale
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_74.text: Power beyond mortal reckoning, held in the palm of your hand. And what mighty works will you turn that hand to?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_84.speaker: Astarion
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_84.text: Now you have it all - unlimited power. So what will you do with it?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_103.speaker: Minsc
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_103.text: SHUT UP, BOO! Tell on, my friend - what will you do next?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_104.speaker: Halsin
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_104.text: You have prevailed. Power beyond measure now rests in your hand... but how to wield it?

FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_54.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_EvilAvatar_54.text: *But what shall you do with such power? Rule this world? Conquer others? Snuff out all life? Or something else entirely? Your darkest dreams are now possible.*

DestructionOfBrain_10.speaker: Narrator
DestructionOfBrain_10.text: *Hopes, nightmares, and the screams of legions upon legions of unborn illithids.*
DestructionOfBrain_10.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Netherbrain dying in pain]
Netherbrain is in the process of executing the player's order to self-destruct, screaming in otherworldly pain.

DestructionOfBrain_4.speaker: Narrator
DestructionOfBrain_4.text: *The pain rips through you, obliterating all thought, all feeling.*
DestructionOfBrain_4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player covering ears]
The player covers their ears and grits their teeth.

DestructionOfBrain_0.speaker: Narrator
DestructionOfBrain_0.text: *The pain rips through you, obliterating all thought, all feeling. You can feel your tadpole burning, and the power it granted you starting to wane.*
DestructionOfBrain_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player covering ears]
The player covers their ears and grits their teeth.

DestructionOfBrain_8.speaker: Narrator
DestructionOfBrain_8.text: *Silence. Free of Urge and worm, your brain is battered and bruised, but it is yours. Yours at last.*
DestructionOfBrain_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stops clutching their head/ears and looks around for just a moment -

DestructionOfBrain_2.speaker: Narrator
DestructionOfBrain_2.text: *Silence. The overbearing quiet of your Father's disappointment before the rush of your tragic fall.*
DestructionOfBrain_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stops clutching their head/ears and looks around for just a moment -

DestructionOfBrain_7.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Brain and player fall into bay]

The brain, spewing blood and goo, plummets into the bay, sending large waves in every direction. 
At the same time the player and party fall as the thing they were standing on gives way.

DestructionOfBrain_6.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Party members surface]
Close up on the dark water, and then the player avatar breaks the surface, drawing breath

DestructionOfBrain_3.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Party swims to shore]
The party swims to shore and join their other allies.

DestructionOfBrain_1.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Battle over]
Everyone looks up at the war-torn city.

DestructionOfBrain_5.speaker: Narrator
DestructionOfBrain_5.text: *Silence. For the first time in a long time, your thoughts are entirely your own. And then - gravity.*
DestructionOfBrain_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stops clutching their head/ears and looks around for just a moment -

AD_KilledEmperor_0.speaker: Player
AD_KilledEmperor_0.text: That's the end of the Emperor.

CombatOver_SoloDurge_21.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_21.text: *If only you'd defied your Father when you had the chance, and freed yourself of your dark desires... but it's too late now.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_11.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_11.text: *Your destiny is set. Your very blood shall clot with the Urge, and that hungry desire will consume you.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_2.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_2.text: *You disobeyed the Lord of Murder. But his hold on you remains... It gnaws... You are hungry.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_18.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_18.text: *You may have freed the world from the control of the Netherbrain, but you are not yet free.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_7.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_7.text: *Your Father is angry. What foul punishment awaits you now that you have rejected him?*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_0.speaker: Player
CombatOver_SoloDurge_0.text: You are strong. You defeated a Netherbrain. Surely you can defeat the Lord of Murder?

CombatOver_SoloDurge_27.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_27.text: *And just like that, it's over. Whatever's left of you is subsumed by the overwhelming strength of your desires.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_19.speaker: Player
CombatOver_SoloDurge_19.text: Whatever it is, you deserve it.

CombatOver_SoloDurge_5.speaker: Player
CombatOver_SoloDurge_5.text: You must be contained. You will go to prison, and ask for the strongest handcuffs they have.

CombatOver_SoloDurge_26.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_26.text: *Even now, your desires threaten to consume you. Your only hope is that a prison will be sufficient to contain you while you spend the rest of your life pondering your sins.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_8.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_8.text: *But it seems your Father has other ideas.*

CombatOver_SoloDurge_25.speaker: Player
CombatOver_SoloDurge_25.text: This cannot be allowed to happen. One final act of resistance - kill yourself.

CombatOver_SoloDurge_12.speaker: Player
CombatOver_SoloDurge_12.text: You are depravity compounded on depravity. You cannot be allowed to live. Take your own life.

CombatOver_SoloDurge_22.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_22.text: *You've butchered so many before - each death a gift to your Father. But this one, you will take from him. This one is just for you.*
CombatOver_SoloDurge_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge looks at the knife in contemplation. Stabs themselves multiple times (reuse if possible) once the narrator's line is done.

CombatOver_SoloDurge_3.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_SoloDurge_3.text: *You've butchered so many before - each death a gift to your Father. But this one, you will take from him. This one is just for you.*
CombatOver_SoloDurge_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge looks at the knife in contemplation. Stabs themselves multiple times (reuse if possible) once the narrator's line is done.

Intro_27.speaker: Gale
Intro_27.text: Can't you feel it? We're almost there.

Intro_212.speaker: Gale
Intro_212.text: Once we ascend the Netherbrain's stem, we'll be in touching distance of the crown. Of reclaiming the powers of Karsus himself.

Intro_272.speaker: Player
Intro_272.text: I'm ready. Let's get you that crown.

Intro_150.speaker: Player
Intro_150.text: Wait. We could end this now if you unleashed the orb.

Intro_146.speaker: Gale
Intro_146.text: And I would die in the process, just to win the favour of a goddess who scarcely cares for me. We discussed this at length - I thought you and I were of a similar mind.

Intro_112.speaker: Player
Intro_112.text: We did, but look at the devastation around us. You need to end this now.

Intro_86.speaker: Gale
Intro_86.text: I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and seize the Crown anyway, you know.

Intro_243.speaker: Player
Intro_243.text: You could, but you won't. You know the stakes are too high to give in to your own ambitions.

Intro_184.speaker: Player
Intro_184.text: I know you won't. I trust you.

Intro_37.speaker: Gale
Intro_37.text: Sometimes I wish I were a more selfish man. Life would be so much easier. But alas...

Intro_256.speaker: Gale
Intro_256.text: You're right. The orb is the only way. All that's left for me to do is spirit you away to safety. Are you ready?

Intro_75.speaker: Player
Intro_75.text: No, I want to stay by your side.

Intro_21.speaker: Gale
Intro_21.text: Please... this will be so much easier knowing that my memory lives on with you.

Intro_72.speaker: Player
Intro_72.text: I'm not going anywhere. We stay together, right to the end.

Intro_8.speaker: Gale
Intro_8.text: No. Let me do this on my terms. Besides - I need someone left to sing my praises, after I'm gone.

Intro_71.speaker: Player
Intro_71.text: You presume I wouldn't stand by your side, right to the end.

Intro_26.speaker: Gale
Intro_26.text: No... I would not presume that. I know quality when I see it.

Intro_195.speaker: Gale
Intro_195.text: But it won't come to that, for I have the means to spirit away those I care about to a safe remove, before the final curtain.

Intro_229.speaker: Gale
Intro_229.text: I thought I meant more to you than a sacrificial lamb. Clearly I was mistaken. I will not cast everything away, not when I know what's out there, almost within my grasp.
Intro_229.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

Intro_140.speaker: Gale
Intro_140.text: If the fight should turn against us, and we have no other option, then rest assured I shall unleash the orb. But I believe there is a much grander destiny in store for us.

Intro_135.speaker: Player
Intro_135.text: Are you sure you want this crown? Look at the damage it's caused...

Intro_109.speaker: Gale
Intro_109.text: You urged me to this point, and now you falter? What would you have me do, sacrifice myself and hope that Mystra eulogises my ashes?

Intro_117.speaker: Player
Intro_117.text: No. But surely you see now how dangerous the crown is? We must make sure it's destroyed.

Intro_233.speaker: Gale
Intro_233.text: If you're wrong, we'll have squandered the chance for a better world. You understand that, don't you?

Intro_246.speaker: Gale
Intro_246.text: But... perhaps saving the day will suffice for now. A better world can always follow, so long as we survive.

Intro_16.speaker: Gale
Intro_16.text: Your fears are misplaced - the Crown will lead to a better world for all. I cannot ignore that.

Intro_58.speaker: Player
Intro_58.text: You're right. We're getting you that crown.

Intro_151.speaker: Gale
Intro_151.text: Then I think it's about time we ascended, don't you?

Intro_103.speaker: Player
Intro_103.text: So be it. But if the tide of battle turns against us, be ready to end this.

Intro_0.speaker: Gale
Intro_0.text: Should it come to that, I will not hesitate. But I think a different destiny awaits us.

Intro_259.speaker: Player
Intro_259.text: You must use the orb, Gale. Your sacrifice will save everything.

Intro_49.speaker: Lae'zel
Intro_49.text: You're distracted. Speak, or let your thoughts haunt you.

Intro_240.speaker: Astarion
Intro_240.text: Gale? You have a look. I'm not sure I care for it.
Intro_240.context: NodeContext: Gale looks somber and fatalistic

Intro_274.speaker: Halsin
Intro_274.text: Gale - what's troubling you? We're nearly at the end, I know it

Intro_4.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_4.text: Are you well, Gale? This would be a bad spot to fall into a faint.
Intro_4.context: NodeContext: Side-eyed concern - personal worry, but also pragmatism that this is the worst possible moment for Gale to fall ill. We are standing atop the Netherbrain, floating high above the city

Intro_178.speaker: The Emperor
Intro_178.text: I can feel it - the thing in your chest - it's ready to blow, isn't it? It's certainly a possible way out...

Intro_261.speaker: Player
Intro_261.text: The orb stirs because it knows the Crown of Karsus is close. It waits for you to claim it. All you have to do is ascend.

Intro_216.speaker: Player
Intro_216.text: If it seems like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me.

Intro_137.speaker: Lae'zel
Intro_137.text: ...and the Grand Design will be stopped. An honourable contingency, Gale. And one I mean to avoid.

Intro_180.speaker: Shadowheart
Intro_180.text: No harm in clinging to optimism a little longer. If events turn against us, at least we'll know you can act. The Absolute isn't winning, one way or another.

Intro_228.speaker: Astarion
Intro_228.text: Well I care for that even less. Let's make sure we prevail, then.
Intro_228.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

Intro_120.speaker: Wyll
Intro_120.text: Perish the thought. I have no intention of failing, and neither should you.

Intro_22.speaker: Karlach
Intro_22.text: I'm on borrowed time anyway. But don't pull the pin until you have to, hey? We might still win the old fashioned way.

Intro_1.speaker: Halsin
Intro_1.text: That orb can deliver us victory - but a sort that we would not live to enjoy. Let us at least see how we fare, and if all else fails... the option remains.

Intro_24.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_24.text: Then we'd best win, wizard. If we cannot... well, this is quite the view.
Intro_24.context: NodeContext: Having just been warned that Gale might need to self-destruct if we're losing the battle - which would kill us all

Intro_20.speaker: Minsc
Intro_20.text: To die destroying a great and grotesque brain - I think this might well be my destiny.
Intro_20.context: NodeContext: Pure, breathless wonder - he's excited for the battle to come, and not at all put off by the prospect of certain death

Intro_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Intro_17.text: The moment our victory is not assured, do not hesitate. Destroy the brain, whatever the cost - even if it is our lives.
Intro_17.context: NodeContext: determined, but with a heavy undertone of grief. She's ready to die if it's necessary, but she REALLY wants to live - and is thinking of her unborn child's life as well.

Intro_116.speaker: Player
Intro_116.text: Move forward. Perhaps you will find a way to stop the brain, without resorting to the orb.

Intro_265.speaker: Narrator
Intro_265.text: *Perhaps united, you can stop the brain without having to resort to the orb... but should you risk failure, the final, irreversible solution remains within your power.*

Intro_159.speaker: Player
Intro_159.text: This is where we part ways. I'm sending you someplace safe, then I'm going to put a stop to this - alone.

Intro_45.speaker: Lae'zel
Intro_45.text: You were always a stubborn one, Gale. Well - if this is to be your end, then you have made the most of it.

Intro_196.speaker: Shadowheart
Intro_196.text: You'd do that? Sacrifice yourself for us...? If this is truly what you want, then thank you.

Intro_231.speaker: Astarion
Intro_231.text: I... I don't know what to say. Thank you.

Intro_12.speaker: Wyll
Intro_12.text: Damned stubborn fool. We can stop this thing. You don't have to -
Intro_12.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

Intro_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale casts a teleportation spell on his companions. A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping them It grows in intensity, into a vortex. When it fades, they are gone. Gale turns to ascend the stalk.

Intro_115.speaker: Karlach
Intro_115.text: See you on the other side, Gale. It's been an honour.

Intro_255.speaker: Halsin
Intro_255.text: You would step forth, alone, to save the world at the expense of your own life. There would be no greater sacrifice.

Intro_99.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_99.text: Too foolish for me to allow, pup. So why do I feel like you aren't asking? Ah.
Intro_99.context: NodeContext: Looking at threat ahead, then back to Gale. He's making a heroic sacrifice - the 'Ah' is after a beat as she recognises what he's about to do  - cast a spell to send her away.

Intro_144.speaker: Minsc
Intro_144.text: Alone, wizard? I thought you were of the clever kind. Boo and I are here, and here we -
Intro_144.context: NodeContext: Refusing to let Gale go on alone - is cut off mid-sentence as Gale teleports them away

Intro_36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Intro_36.text: And what if your nerve fails at the last, wizard? I would rather trust my courage than yours.
Intro_36.context: NodeContext: intense moment - the final battle is unfolding, and Gale just offered to sacrifice himself. Minthara is not convinced

Intro_141.speaker: Player
Intro_141.text: Step forward - alone. Once up there, you must unleash the orb without hesitation, or all is lost.

Intro_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale steps towards the stalk, grimly determined expression

Intro_254.speaker: Minsc
Intro_254.text: You do not look well, wizard. Beyond even your daily feebleness.
Intro_254.context: NodeContext: Brute concern, in his own way. Gale is looking up at the Netherbrain, his chest orb preparing to explode

Intro_23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Intro_23.text: Are you afraid, wizard? There is no shame in it when faced with madness such as this.
Intro_23.context: NodeContext: determined and reassuring - gentler than her usual self, as she encourages an ally to show courage right before the final battle with the netherbrain

Intro_204.speaker: Gale
Intro_204.text: I can end this now - stop the Absolute, and spare the city. The stage is set for my final act. Mystra's bidding. And the redemption that lies beyond.

Intro_186.speaker: Gale
Intro_186.text: You've brought me right where I need to be - I have no right to ask more of you. It's time I spirited you to safety, for this is a fate I must face alone.
Intro_186.context: NodeContext: readying himself for death, saying goodbye

Intro_191.speaker: Player
Intro_191.text: I don't want to leave you.

Intro_41.speaker: Player
Intro_41.text: Forget it, Gale. You don't have to do this.

Intro_131.speaker: Gale
Intro_131.text: What's the alternative? I allow the Absolute to have its way? Die in vain along with all its victims? Or flee, and live on in shame?

Intro_257.speaker: Gale
Intro_257.text: It's just a choice between two deaths. Quick and meaningful, or torturous and pointless.

Intro_211.speaker: Player
Intro_211.text: Are you sure about this? There must be another way - one that lets you live.

Intro_74.speaker: Gale
Intro_74.text: I'm sure such an outcome is possible, but why risk it? If we ascend there, and try to fight the good fight... well, there're no guarantees.

Intro_193.speaker: Gale
Intro_193.text: But this way, we'll know the matter is done, and we'll know exactly what it shall cost - me, and me alone.

Intro_7.speaker: Player
Intro_7.text: You know there's always another way.

Intro_57.speaker: Gale
Intro_57.text: Always another way, yes - but not necessarily a better way.

Intro_90.speaker: Player
Intro_90.text: What about all we shared together? Are you just going to give up?

Intro_52.speaker: Gale
Intro_52.text: This isn't giving up it's securing victory, at a price I am willing to pay. And everything we shared can live on - with you.

Intro_168.speaker: Player
Intro_168.text: No, we can ascend together and put an end to this. Should it look like we'll fail... that's your moment.

Intro_6.speaker: Gale
Intro_6.text: You'd be dying in vain. I don't need company to sacrifice myself.

Intro_260.speaker: Gale
Intro_260.text: Please. For too long I've lived in fear of taking a host of innocents with me when I expired. Now at least I can be assured my demise will be saving them instead.

Intro_98.speaker: Player
Intro_98.text: No, Gale. We're going to end this together - and live to tell the tale.

Intro_176.speaker: Gale
Intro_176.text: If you're mistaken, this could be the end of everything. We will be failing, right at the last hurdle.

Intro_218.speaker: Gale
Intro_218.text: But... I only made it this far thanks to you. Who am I to question such sterling guidance now?

Intro_227.speaker: Gale
Intro_227.text: Mystra won't be pleased... but perhaps trying to please the gods is a fool's errand.
Intro_227.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

Intro_175.speaker: Gale
Intro_175.text: Lead on, then. I shall stay my hand as long as I can - but if the tide of battle turns against us, remember I have the means to bring a swift end to this.

Intro_234.speaker: Player
Intro_234.text: I won't stand in your way, then. Farewell, Gale.

Intro_61.speaker: Gale
Intro_61.text: There's endless wonder out there. Infinite possibilities. Perhaps fate will bring us back together, before the universe dims.

Intro_190.speaker: Gale
Intro_190.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale begins to cast a teleportation spell.NodeContext: Latin: foo-GA-moos in-FER-nee blan-dee-MEN-ta

Intro_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping the player. It grows in intensity, into a vortex. Player's POV: one last glimpse of Gale smiling sadly, before the blue magic swallows his image...

Intro_31.speaker: Player
Intro_31.text: If this is truly what you want...

Intro_28.speaker: Gale
Intro_28.text: What I want is a life I could share with you, but alas... knowing you're still out there will suffice for now.

Intro_89.speaker: Gale
Intro_89.text: What I want? Perhaps not... But what I need? I believe so. But it may not be the last turn of the page, even if it seems so.

Intro_262.speaker: Player
Intro_262.text: You don't have to do this, Gale. We can bring the Crown to Mystra.

Intro_5.speaker: Player
Intro_5.text: Gesture to the fact that you are now a mind flayer. Gale's self-sacrifice is not necessary.

Intro_33.speaker: Gale
Intro_33.text: Still, you will be taking unnecessary risks by proceeding. This could all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.

Intro_85.speaker: Player
Intro_85.text: Orpheus has already transformed into a mind flayer.

Intro_200.speaker: Gale
Intro_200.text: True, but it's not too late to reconsider. This would all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.

Intro_241.speaker: Player
Intro_241.text: We have the Emperor's support - your sacrifice isn't necessary.

Intro_73.speaker: Gale
Intro_73.text: Are you quite sure you wish to place all your trust there? This would all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.

Intro_145.speaker: Player
Intro_145.text: You intend to go up there by yourself? To die alone?

Intro_139.speaker: Gale
