Intro_139.text: As much as I enjoy your company, I'm not willing to kill you just to wring out a few last moments.

Intro_50.speaker: Player
Intro_50.text: Don't be ridiculous, Gale. This isn't necessary.

Intro_132.speaker: Gale
Intro_132.text: I must disagree. It is necessary - and the right thing to do. Every moment I hesitate is costing lives.

Intro_51.speaker: Narrator
Intro_51.context: CinematicNodeContext:  |You grab onto the tentacle, pulses of mocking noise burst through your mind. You push through, take a firm grip and make your ascent.|

Intro_164.speaker: Narrator
Intro_164.text: *There it is - the Crown of Karsus, the site of power, the site of domination.*
Intro_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up and sees the Crown of Kharsus.

Intro_127.speaker: Lae'zel
Intro_127.text: We need to use the Netherstones on the Crown. That is our fated path.

Intro_205.speaker: Shadowheart
Intro_205.text: The Netherstones - perhaps if we use them here, they'll work this time.

Intro_217.speaker: Astarion
Intro_217.text: That's it! We have to use the Netherstones on the Crown - it's the only hope we have.

Intro_165.speaker: Wyll
Intro_165.text: There lies our answer. Use the Netherstones on the Crown, and we can bring an end to this.

Intro_206.speaker: Gale
Intro_206.text: The Netherstones might prove more effective if we use them now.

Intro_126.speaker: Karlach
Intro_126.text: Looks like that Crown could use some Netherstones. If these things were ever going to work, it's now.

Intro_268.speaker: Halsin
Intro_268.text: The Netherstones may yet work - this time.

Intro_25.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_25.text: If we are to try the stones once more - we ought to do it there.
Intro_25.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

Intro_125.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor lands in battle on a dragon. 
Party reacts with horror. 
Emperor makes a gesture with his hand to summon the super-Daisies

Intro_244.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, a bunch of human-sized growth-pods emerge from the netherbrain's surface. They split apart and the Daisy forms of the present party members step out, ready for combat.

Intro_197.speaker: Lae'zel
Intro_197.text: That face... the one in my dreams...

Intro_153.speaker: Shadowheart
Intro_153.text: That's... that's the person from my dreams...

Intro_215.speaker: Astarion
Intro_215.text: I know you - I saw you in my dreams.

Intro_170.speaker: Wyll
Intro_170.text: That face. The one from my dreams...

Intro_114.speaker: Karlach
Intro_114.text: My gods! I didn't think they were real. Not really.

Intro_161.speaker: Halsin
Intro_161.text: The infamous figure from your dreams, I take it.

Intro_185.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_185.text: Your dream visitors, I take it? I thought they would be prettier.
Intro_185.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

Intro_208.speaker: Minsc
Intro_208.text: The dream invaders - but these ones have real skulls for the splitting.
Intro_208.context: NodeContext: Violent relish -  the Brain has just spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must figh

Intro_97.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Intro_97.text: If we must butcher our dreams, so be it.

Intro_267.speaker: The Emperor
Intro_267.text: I know you. I know everything about you. Your thoughts, your feelings, your weaknesses.
Intro_267.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor disembarks dragonNodeContext: Emperor is against the player now, and enthralled to the Netherbrain

Intro_19.speaker: The Emperor
Intro_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisys advance to flank the Emperor.NodeContext: with pure malice

Intro_252.speaker: Minsc
Intro_252.text: There - let us try the stones on the tyrant's tiara!
Intro_252.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

Intro_64.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Intro_64.text: That is our target. Focus the power of the Netherstones on the crown, and we may yet triumph!
Intro_64.context: NodeContext: the final battle against the netherbrain is underway - the struggle is desperate, but Minthara rallies herself and her allies with a final command

Intro_118.speaker: Narrator
Intro_118.text: *The place where the Netherstones can enforce control.*

Intro_105.speaker: The Emperor
Intro_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up and sees the Crown of Kharsus.

Intro_183.speaker: The Emperor
Intro_183.text: The very thing that has been amplifying the Netherbrain's power, and the very place that we will be able to dominate it.

Intro_123.speaker: The Emperor
Intro_123.text: That's where we should use the Netherstones.

Intro_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, four (or equivalent number to party) fleshy growth-pods emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them.

Intro_38.speaker: Shadowheart
Intro_38.text: What the hells are those things?!

Intro_157.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_157.text: The ratcatcher that became a lord.

Intro_250.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_250.text: The ratcatcher that became a lord.

Intro_119.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_119.text: The false daughter of darkness. Shunned by her goddess.

Intro_121.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_121.text: The puppet of the githyanki queen.

Intro_156.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_156.text: The wizard who defied a goddess.

Intro_155.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_155.text: The hamster that voyaged through wildspace.

Intro_202.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_202.text: And you will make an even better thrall.

Intro_40.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_40.text: And you will make spectacular thralls.

Intro_242.context: CinematicNodeContext: Four fleshy growth-pods  emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them. A red dragon lands. The thralls and dragon prepare for combat.

Intro_269.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_269.text: The hatchling who rejected her queen.

Intro_92.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_92.text: The false daughter of darkness. Shunned by her goddess.

Intro_101.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_101.text: The puppet of the githyanki queen.

Intro_65.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_65.text: The hatchling who rejected her queen.

Intro_129.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_129.text: The wizard who defied a goddess.

Intro_95.speaker: Elder Brain
Intro_95.text: The hamster that voyaged through wildspace.

Intro_69.speaker: Gale
Intro_69.text: What in the Hells are those?

Intro_94.speaker: Halsin
Intro_94.text: Fresh horrors. They will fall, like all the others.

Intro_225.speaker: Jaheira
Intro_225.text: Oh, because it wasn't quite crowded enough up here already.
Intro_225.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

Intro_192.speaker: Minsc
Intro_192.text: Eh, Boo? Can this Netherbrain sprout Nether-lice?
Intro_192.context: NodeContext: Note of vague bemusement - we've just watched the netherbrain graphically spawn a number of super-thralls that we must fight atop it.

Intro_66.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Intro_66.text: Is there no end to these horrors?
Intro_66.context: NodeContext: witnessing the creation of horrifying fleshy monsters during the final fight with the netherbrain - aghast, and slightly in awe

Intro_96.speaker: Narrator
Intro_96.text: *A thought occurs to you as you gaze at the monstrosity above. Gale's orb remains an option - one that could put an end to the Absolute, once and for all.*

Intro_152.speaker: Gale
Intro_152.text: You're plotting something, aren't you? Come on then - out with it. I'd rather know before we take on that cerebral monstrosity.
Intro_152.context: NodeContext: An edge of concern - worried what you're about to bring up

Intro_67.speaker: Player
Intro_67.text: Just reminding myself of our plan - we attack the brain, then comes the Emperor's part.

Intro_70.speaker: Gale
Intro_70.text: As viable a plan as any while staring into the maw of perdition. Shall we?

Intro_87.speaker: Player
Intro_87.text: Your orb - the fight we're facing could be over before it even begins... if you're willing to make the sacrifice.

Intro_81.speaker: Gale
Intro_81.text: I thought I made my feelings plain - I do not want to take that step. Not anymore.

Intro_224.speaker: Gale
Intro_224.text: Besides - such a sacrifice won't be necessary if I claim the Crown of Karsus.

Intro_219.speaker: Gale
Intro_219.text: You make it sound like such a small thing. No - I do not wish to die.

Intro_80.speaker: Gale
Intro_80.text: If there is even the slimmest chance of success once we ascend, I wish to pursue it.

Intro_210.speaker: Player
Intro_210.text: Mystra will never forgive you for refusing her command. Can you live with that?

Intro_11.speaker: Gale
Intro_11.text: If I live at all, it will be no thanks to her. She didn't even deign to speak to me herself. Let her burn with fury - I choose to live.

Intro_270.speaker: Player
Intro_270.text: Are you certain you know what you're going to do with it?

Intro_106.speaker: Gale
Intro_106.text: There's no sense dwelling on such a future is locked behind the looming shadow of the Netherbrain. First, we must fight. Then we deal with the Crown.

Intro_239.speaker: Player
Intro_239.text: Mystra will never forgive you if you allow the crown to slip from your grasp. The orb guarantees redemption.

Intro_162.speaker: Player
Intro_162.text: The world is counting on us, and the Netherbrain is too powerful. I can't bear the thought of losing you, but the orb is the only guarantee.

Intro_148.speaker: Gale
Intro_148.text: No. I can't give up... and I don't want this to be how I part from you. Let us at least try.

Intro_108.speaker: Player
Intro_108.text: The world is counting on us, and the Netherbrain is too powerful. The orb is the only guarantee of victory we have.

Intro_258.speaker: Gale
Intro_258.text: I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and take on the brain alone, you know.
Intro_258.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

Intro_10.speaker: Gale
Intro_10.text: I'm too long in the tooth to play sacrificial lamb - sacrificial bearded goat, more like. I will not just give in to the orb. Not when I've made it this far.

Intro_263.speaker: Player
Intro_263.text: Keep it in mind at least, should the tide of battle turn against us.

Intro_46.speaker: Gale
Intro_46.text: Should circumstances become that dire, I will not hesitate. But I dearly hope that will not be necessary.

Intro_142.speaker: Player
Intro_142.text: You're certain, then. I won't try to force you to do otherwise. Let's keep going.

Intro_181.speaker: Gale
Intro_181.text: I'm glad. It would be more than a touch awkward if you tried and I had to turn on you.

Intro_271.speaker: Gale
Intro_271.text: That said, should the worst transpire, and we seem destined to fail... well, the orb remains an option. But I truly hope it does not come to that.

Intro_76.speaker: Player
Intro_76.text: I understand, but I had to mention it while there was time. Let's carry on and end this.

Intro_203.speaker: Gale
Intro_203.text: I'm as ready as I'll ever be. Should the worst transpire, and we seem destined to fail... well, the orb remains an option. But I truly hope it does not come to that.

Intro_62.speaker: Player
Intro_62.text: Just reminding myself of our plan - we attack the brain, then comes Orpheus' part.

Intro_56.speaker: Player
Intro_56.text: Say nothing. You have already transformed yourself in order to stop the Absolute. That should remain the plan.

Intro_251.speaker: Player
Intro_251.text: It's nothing - just gathering myself. Let's proceed.

Intro_138.speaker: Gale
Intro_138.text: The brain... it's high above the city now - far away from any innocents.

Intro_273.speaker: Narrator
Intro_273.text: *As you gaze upwards at the monstrosity above you, the orb in your chest seems to pulse, like a dark second heart.*

FinalDecision_Nested_Kill_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks out at all those kneeling before them. They extend one hand and caress the air. Psionic magic pulses outward. One NPC in the crowd reaches for her cheek, as if she feels the player's caress. Others around her do the same.

FinalDecision_Nested_Kill_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grins evilly and turns their hand into a grasping claw pose, as if strangling thin air. The NPC and all around  her begin gasping and clawing at their throats to no avail.

FinalDecision_Nested_Kill_0.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Kill_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player continues to grip. All around them, the sounds of a crowd gasping and strangling.

FinalDecision_Nested_Kill_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Present companions are shown dying

FinalDecision_Nested_Kill_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Then, the players fist closes shut, and there is a sickening CRUNCH. Masses of bodies collapse. The player is surrounded by the dead.

FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Player looks at the massed thralls around and the fleet of nautiloids dotted across the skyline. They pulse out a psionic command to all.

FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest_4.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest_4.text: *This is but the first conquest. Every realm shall quake at your power. Every tongue shall speak your name in awe. Every god shall perish in your shadow. This world is yours. Now for the rest.*

FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The enthralled masses reach for discarded weapons around them - pitchforks. staffs, spears etc - and stand at the player's beckoning. They start to beat the butts of their improvised weapons on the ground in rhythm with one another, a sort of martial stomp. We focus in on one particular pitchfork beating the ground over and over -

FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Match cut to: the same frame and movement, but it is now a new spear, being held by someone in a new, dark uniform.

FinalDecision_Nested_Conquest_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wider, and we see the enthralled rabble is now a disciplined army, with matching uniforms and weaponry. All very neat and fascist. Others are shown marching out of the city in precise formation. Above  the buildings around them, a nautiloid rises into the air...

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_61.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_61.text: I feel more powerful than ever.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_52.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_52.text: I saved the world. The sacrifice was worth it.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_80.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_80.text: We wouldn't have succeeded without your guidance.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_66.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_66.text: You made your own choices. I merely nudged you in the direction that would result in our greatest chance of success.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_11.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_11.text: For what it's worth, I think you are much improved now.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_55.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_55.text: I may not be able to read your thoughts anymore, but I'm certain I know them -

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_106.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_106.text: No doubt you will use them to summon the Crown. But what then? What will you do when such power is in your grasp?

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_14.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_14.text: I will reforge the Crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_58.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_58.text: I must confess, I admire your ambition almost as much as I fear its consequences.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_45.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_45.text: A word of advice - keep the stones close to you. For as we have seen, even a Netherbrain can be dominated.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_23.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_23.text: I will deliver the Crown to Mystra, to ensure that none may access such power again.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_115.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_115.text: A wise decision, and a humble one.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_7.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_7.text: Perhaps Mystra will even see fit to forgive you for making such a choice, and cure you of the orb.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_79.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_79.text: I will deliver the Crown to Mystra - it will be safer in her hands than in the hands of mortals.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_96.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_96.text: You hold her opinion above mine still? In spite of all she's done to you?

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_33.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_33.text: Then for your sake I hope she shows you mercy. Or that you do to her.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_47.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_47.text: I'll leave the Crown where it is. So long as it's separated from the stones, no one will ever wield its power again.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_94.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_94.text: Then keep the stones close. There will be those who seek to take them from you. To stake their claim on power, even though you do not.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_19.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_19.text: I wish you well, Gale of Waterdeep, for the fate of our world will depend on their failure to find you, or your success in defeating them when they do.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_101.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_101.text: You're wondering what became of the Netherstones.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_39.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_39.text: They're lost to the Chionthar, with the Crown. Neither you nor anyone else will ever wield them again.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_60.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_60.text: So what will you do now, Gale of Waterdeep?

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_86.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_86.text: *The orb pulses within you still - Elminster's magic is all that keeps it contained. As long as the magic remains, so do you.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_57.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_57.text: *But the orb is not your only concern.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_6.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_6.text: *Whatever time is left is yours and yours alone.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_37.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_37.text: It's time I return to my books - they've been piling up, unread for too long.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_27.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_27.text: The expansion of one's mind with the intellect of others' is never a bad idea.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_3.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_3.text: I must seek Elminster's counsel - I must find a way to stabilise the orb for good.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_0.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_0.text: No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_48.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_48.text: I wish you well in this.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_109.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_109.text: There are so many worlds I'm yet to see, and not much time to see them. I feel my next adventure calling.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_41.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_41.text: Our achievements must not be lost to posterity. I shall write this tale that all may learn from it.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_117.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_117.text: I trust you will enjoy the process, for few will believe the stories you have to tell.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_73.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_73.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_93.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_93.text: *The threat of the Grand Design is over, but your people will never accept you back into their embrace.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_99.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_99.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_1.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_1.text: *What happens next will be by your design, and yours alone.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_10.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_10.text: We should stay in the city. Help to rebuild it.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_24.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_24.text: But I would not recommend it. The city does not welcome the likes of us, at least not on its surface.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_22.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_22.text: I will do what I have always done. I will survive.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_110.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_110.text: This is my city. It needs authority.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_53.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_53.text: Then this is where we part ways?

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_77.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_77.text: Strange, isn't it? To have travelled this far, inseparable from one another, only to cut the cord at the final step.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_30.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_30.text: You have become... important to me.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_105.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_105.text: And should our paths ever cross again, I will be glad to see you.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_31.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_31.text: But I will not be joining you. The city has no love for the likes of me.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_44.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_44.text: Let's get out of this godsforsaken city. I hear Amn is lovely this time of year.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_71.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_71.text: Not a bad idea - it will certainly be safer than staying in the city.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_50.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_50.text: But I will not be joining you.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_118.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_118.text: I think it's time we part ways.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_88.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_88.text: Battle forms comrades of the coldest souls, but it seems that yours is determined to stay frozen.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_32.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_32.text: Very well. Then I bid you farewell. And... good luck.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_42.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_42.text: May your path ahead lead you to the allies you desire.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_92.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_92.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have failed your queen.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_87.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_87.text: Return to the city. My home.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_46.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_46.text: You've earned a triumphant homecoming. Though you may find your instincts are somewhat changed - and people will treat you... unkindly.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_84.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_84.text: I'm not sure. This is all very new.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_28.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_28.text: Embrace your evolution. You are more than you've ever been. All that has changed in you has changed for the better.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_8.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_8.text: If you do intend to stay in the city, the Undercellar may offer a suitable refuge while you learn how to hide in plain sight, as I once did.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_119.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_119.text: Well-deserved. You will find your dreams much changed, full of colours and shapes you do not yet recognise. But you will know them, in time.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_2.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_2.text: I'm not ready. It isn't fair.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_78.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_78.text: *One last look to remember. One last look to say goodbye.*

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_104.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_104.text: Live a good life, will you? Make it worthwhile.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_108.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_108.text: I did what I had to do.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_18.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_18.text: I never trusted you - you were just my best chance of survival.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_112.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_112.text: It's a shame - with an attitude like that, you would have made a wonderful illithid.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_107.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_107.text: And that is why we succeeded.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_82.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_82.text: I'm still angry that you manipulated me.

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_64.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_64.text: I really thought at this point that you might have let go of that...

CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_63.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_EmperorSolo_63.text: But it matters not. We succeeded.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_172.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_172.text: *With the githyanki gone, there's nothing left but the silence of the city, smouldering, waiting to be rebuilt.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_172.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player turns from the skies back to the bay. They walk out to the docks to watch the dying rays of the sun ripple across the water.

We could start similar to the Dragon's Arrive Stage from END_BrainBattle_CombatOver, but it's probably simpler to cut to a neutral shot and walk down to the docks.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_372.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_372.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You have the means to reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_372.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, a mind flayer, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_252.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_252.text: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_252.context: NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_220.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_220.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You could reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_220.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_316.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_316.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. You will salvage the stones and reforge the Crown, the power of Netheril in your hands at last.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_316.context: NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_10.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_10.text: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_10.context: NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_152.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_152.text: *Once the Crown is restored, you could return it to Mystra, fulfilling her wishes, and ridding the mortal world of such temptation.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_152.context: NodeContext: Gale is speculating one path he could take (the morally good one)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_257.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_257.text: *Or... you could take control of it for yourself, and become a god.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_257.context: NodeContext: Speculating on the other path Gale could take (the ambitious one) - becoming a god and having absolute power

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_213.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_213.text: *Your allies' journeys may have ended with the Netherbrain's death, but yours has not.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_209.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_209.text: *One way or another, you will have to reckon with your god. It's time to speak to Mystra.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_209.context: NodeContext: The moment before Gale speaks to his god, Mystra

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_136.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_136.text: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. If you salvage the stones, you could claim it, reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_136.context: InternalNodeContext: KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING CROWNNodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_64.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_64.text: *Mystra's summons still stands. Bring the Crown to her and she may yet offer you a cure, but there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_64.context: InternalNodeContext: Knows Mystra wants to speak to youNodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of doing what Mystra says

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_84.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_84.text: *Already you feel the orb straining against the confines of Elminster's spell. It will not hold forever. How will you spend the time that you have left?*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_169.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: would be nice to show the companions walking up behind the player here, but that's a lot of work.InternalNodeContext: LOGIC: HAS COMPANIONS

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_79.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_79.text: I suggest we take a moment to rest, recuperate, and drink the nectars of victory.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_79.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_83.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_83.text: And you, Gale? What are your next steps?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_191.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_191.text: I will not be joining you. I've a Crown to reforge, and perhaps - a chance to become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_116.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_116.text: Wield a god's power, and expect the full weight of opposing gods' wrath. I expect Mystra will be the first you contend with.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_116.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_371.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_371.text: *The very air around you thrums with anticipation, and fear. Can you really handle such power, such authority?*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_371.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale contemplating his newfound power, feeling his isolation from his surroundings and his partyNodeContext: speaking of Gale, who is fairly sure he's about to become a god

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_128.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_128.text: *Whyever not? After all, you are an illithid - whatever flaws plagued you as a human are long behind you now.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale in Illithid form, flexing his Illithid magic, interwoven with Karsite magicInternalNodeContext: ILLITHID

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_227.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_227.text: *Your allies seek to celebrate, but they know not what is to come. Yours will be a different future - a glorious one, and you will walk it alone.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_227.context:
CinematicNodeContext: As Gale is empowered, he vanishes.

The camera zooms out of the party confused by where he has disappeared to.

The final image settles on the Sun in the evening sky, with VFX taking on the shape of Gale's tattoo, underscoring his godlike powersInternalNodeContext: HAS COMPANIONS

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_177.context: InternalNodeContext: LOGIC: END NODE SOLO GALE AV

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_162.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_162.text: *There's only one way to find out.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale, determined, the course is set

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_268.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_268.text: Ambitious - don't let Mystra hear you say that.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_268.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_107.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_107.text: An ambitious enterprise. One I doubt Mystra will stand for.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_107.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_292.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_292.text: Such ambition - you make me look positively humble.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_292.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_17.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_17.text: I can't fault your ambition. I don't know if I'd pick a fight with Mystra myself, but more power to you.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_17.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_214.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_214.text: Minsc and Boo wish you well, my friend - but think this is perhaps the way into Mystra's bad books, not back into her heart.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_214.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_111.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_111.text: A lofty goal. Be careful of Mystra - she shall not care to have a new rival.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_111.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_377.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_377.text: A humble task ahead, then. And one in which your Mystra will no doubt wish you well.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_377.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly. Jaheira's line mildly sarcastic - 'oh, is that all'

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_190.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_190.text: I wish you well. And if Mystra stands in your way, call on me, wizard. I have acquired a taste for killing gods.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_190.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, and Minthara relishes the opportunity to fight Mystra by his side. The 'god' she is talking about killing is Mystra rather than Gale.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_282.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_282.text: If anyone can, it's you, Gale. Whether you should is a question you might consider, though.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_282.context: NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_123.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_123.text: It's time I leave you. I must reforge the Crown. If I offer it to Mystra, perhaps she'll cure me of the orb.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_272.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_272.text: Only a cruel god would refuse you. May Mystra's wisdom prevail over her enmity.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_272.context: NodeContext: sympathetic (in her own way) to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_254.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_254.text: *Perhaps Mystra will recognise you for your humility, perhaps not.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_219.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_219.text: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - the illithid that defeated a Netherbrain.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_219.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale who made sacrifices

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_174.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_174.text: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - Gale of Waterdeep, the wizard who defeated a Netherbrain.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_174.context: NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_133.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_133.text: Perhaps. I can't speak to the qualities of Mystra, but I can certainly speak to those of her servant.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_133.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest. 'I'm no longer one' = SH has abandoned Shar. 'Perhaps...' = SH is loyal to Shar

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_147.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_147.text: A little demeaning to go running to your god after everything we've achieved, but if that's what it takes to survive...
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_147.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_160.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_160.text: Minsc thinks she is owing you this much, at least. We look forward to your return - healed and pure of chest!
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_160.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_347.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_347.text: Of course, your other condition. But if anything can convince your god to do what's right, the Crown can.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_347.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_277.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_277.text: I'm sure it will come to pass. Find me when it's done - I'll want to hear your story.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_277.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_68.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_68.text: Of course she will. The world has no need for a goddess who would hesitate at such a request from her champion. I hope to see you again, Gale.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_68.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_360.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_360.text: A grand enough gesture to win back her good graces, I think. I wish you luck, wizard.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_360.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_51.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_51.text: You are a wise enough man to know that one should not expect kindness from the gods, Gale.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_51.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_49.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_49.text: I hope she does. And we see each other again soon, both less explosive than ever before.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_49.context: NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_322.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_322.text: You go on ahead. I miss Waterdeep, and I'd like to go home.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_311.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_311.text: A celebration sounds ideal. Whatever time I have left, I'd like to spend it with you.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_18.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_18.text: But what about you, Gale? What will you do now...?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_18.context: NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_344.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_344.text: Although it seems not everyone is in the mood to celebrate. What's happening in that head of yours, Gale?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_344.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] being sensitive to Gale's somewhat thougthful mood

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_102.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_102.text: Gale - what about you? Where do you go from here?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_346.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_346.text: But what awaits you, Gale? Your path ahead is... unclear.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_346.context: NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_97.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_97.text: Now, Gale, you're looking decidedly 'thinky'. I hope you're not about to spoil this excellent, excellent plan.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_97.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale seems to be moping

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_5.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_5.text: Though, first - Gale. What is it you plan to do next?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_5.context: NodeContext: Catching herself as the party was just about to decide on a celebration - Gale's a mind flayer, and shouldn't be forgotten.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_312.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_312.text: You seem distracted, wizard. I can no longer spy your thoughts - so speak them.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_330.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_330.text: Though first - what of you, wizard?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_260.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_260.text: I think a celebration is in order. It's the least we deserve.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_260.context: NodeContext: Like clearing her throat so as to move the party on from scene of battle towards more joyous things

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_221.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_221.text: Well, that's enough world-saving for one day. If any other existential threats appear, someone else can handle it - we are finding a tavern and celebrating.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_221.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_182.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_182.text: A suggestion, if I may: a celebration. I know I could use a few sips of good ale.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_182.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_318.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_318.text: Perhaps it's time for a celebration. We have earned it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_318.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_308.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_308.text: Would anyone else like to sit down? Lie down? Drink until we fall down, perhaps?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_308.context: NodeContext: Breaking a moment of high tension / catharsis with a genuinely exhausted sigh.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_341.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_341.text: No one else wishes to say it? Very well, then. DRINKING!
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_341.context: NodeContext: Looking around, clearing throat before 'DRINKING!'

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_378.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_378.text: I think we've earned a celebration. Don't you?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_378.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_55.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_55.text: Well, if that's everything - and I sincerely hope it is - we should find a tavern and celebrate. We've certainly earned it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_55.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_163.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_163.text: That we have survived is a miracle. I propose we celebrate with whatever filth passes as wine in this city.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_163.context: NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_276.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_276.text: It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The wizard that defeated the Netherbrain.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_22.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_22.text: Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_264.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_264.text: *You could take the Crown to Mystra, perhaps leverage it for a cure. But there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_264.context: NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of interacting with Mystra at this critical juncture

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_380.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_380.text: *You felt the magic of Karsus draining from the stones as the Crown plummeted to the bottom of the Chionthar. A useless trinket, nothing more.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_166.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_166.text: *At least the mortal world will be safe from the temptation of the Crown. But you...*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_43.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_43.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_154.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_154.text: *Your friends and enemies alike are ripe for manipulation, and if not manipulation, then consumption.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_131.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_131.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_129.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_129.text: *Or not. Perhaps you are unique among illithid-kind. Perhaps you will retain enough of who you are to resist your nature.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_337.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_337.text: *A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_267.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_267.text: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_351.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_351.text: You finally have a chance to live. Embrace it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_132.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_132.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_297.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_297.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_24.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_24.text: *But it seems that Gale's mind is elsewhere.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_370.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_370.text: Gale - this is no time for sentimental gawking.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_301.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_301.text: Speak your troubles - or relinquish them.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_301.context: NodeContext: slightly impatent - Gale clearly has something on his mind

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_226.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_226.text: The Crown - it's somewhere in the Chionthar.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_226.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is standing to one side, looking out toward the Chionthar. NodeContext: thoughtful

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_89.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_89.text: If I salvage the stones, I can reforge it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party.NodeContext: subtly excited

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_238.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_238.text: And once I have, I'll return it to Mystra.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_238.context: NodeContext: sure of himself - this is the right thing to do

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_113.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_113.text: With the Crown in my hands, I would be unstoppable. The Karsite Weave would be mine to command.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_113.context: NodeContext: excited by the prospect of power

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_53.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_53.text: I would be more than the greatest wizard who ever lived - I would be a god.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_53.context: NodeContext: emotions rising at the prospect of GODHOOD

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_46.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_46.text: You'll make a fine god, but I can't go with you. I'm sorry.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_247.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_247.text: I understand. You are right to heed such doubts, however much sadness it brings me to leave you behind.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_339.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_339.text: Is that really what you want, Gale?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_148.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_148.text: Want, need, deserve... Choose whatever word you prefer, but it is what I'm going to do.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_338.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_338.text: Mystra has dictated the terms of my potential for long enough. The Crown would grant me control of my own destiny at last.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_158.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_158.text: Think of all I could achieve, all that I could grant to those whose ambitions are restrained by Mystra's yoke. I could raise a new Netheril right here in Faerûn.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_158.context: NodeContext: attempting to rationalise his desire for power, losing himself in this vision of greatness

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_329.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_329.text: Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_300.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_300.text: Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_241.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_241.text: It's I who should be saying such things. Do not think I leave you without a heart as heavy as your own. But I owe it to myself to follow where destiny leads.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_303.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_303.text: I will never forget you - that I promise. And if you ever feel differently, there will be a place waiting for you in the heavens.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_303.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale leavesNodeContext: with affection towards a loved one

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_355.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_355.text: We will be gods together, Gale. I will be right by your side.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_210.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_210.text: That day cannot come soon enough. But first, I must retrieve the Crown.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_210.context: NodeContext: the crown is what's at the front of his mind

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_175.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_175.text: Have patience a while and I will return to you, carrying immortality in one hand and offering you ascension with the other. I will be a god, as will you.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale leavesNodeContext: confidence bordering on intimidating

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_343.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_343.text: Your hubris was your downfall once, Gale. I thought you were wiser than to make the same mistake again.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_4.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_4.text: And I thought you wise enough to recognise that I am not the man I once was.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_161.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_161.text: It seems that we've come to an impasse. I stand on the threshold of divine ascension, and you would try to keep me grounded.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_161.context: NodeContext: confident - he's the one in control here

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_115.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_115.text: It's not your fault - I can hardly expect you to understand. But nor will I relinquish the chance of godhood for a love that would only last a mortal lifetime. I'm sorry.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_115.context: NodeContext: like talking to a child who's too young to know about these things, but with genuine sadness when he speaks of being sad to leave you

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_12.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_12.text: It's not your fault - I can hardly expect you to understand. But nor will I relinquish this chance because you are unwilling to imagine a world where I succeed.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_12.context: NodeContext: like talking to a child who's too young to know about these things, but with genuine sadness when he speaks of being sad to leave you

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_77.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_77.text: I will never forget you - that much I promise. And if one day you feel differently, I would be honoured to have you as my Chosen.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale leavesNodeContext: A little pompous, likes the idea of this shifted dynamic between you. Meant sincerely though.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_369.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_369.text: Gale will be but one god among many - doomed to squabble, to battle, to vie for control and power. And we will be the pieces they play with.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_369.context: NodeContext: with concern - Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_314.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_314.text: But somehow I do not think Mystra will allow it to happen so readily.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_314.context: NodeContext: but not that much concern

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_225.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_225.text: He chose his fate. Now, let us make the most of ours.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_225.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_149.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_149.text: So, what next? Something fun, I hope?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_180.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_180.text: So, what's next for us? The world is our oyster, and she has many pearls we can choose from.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_180.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Asking the player what's next

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_159.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_159.text: So - what now? I don't know about you, but I could use a flagon or three of ale.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_381.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_381.text: What comes now? I cannot remember the last time we did not have a grand purpose to work towards...

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_7.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_7.text: Right. I suppose there is more work to do, now. What first?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_7.context: NodeContext: After a moment of leavetaking / catharsis after winning our final battle. Sighing, drawing herself up for the next task despite her exhaustion

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_349.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_349.text: Well and good, but enough of that. What now? My hamster is hungry.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_197.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_197.text: What shall we do with our liberty?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_50.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_50.text: So, what comes now? A bath certainly wouldn't go amiss...

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_179.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_179.text: Farewell, Gale. I hope he still remembers us little people, once he's secured godhood.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_179.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_141.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_141.text: Though he may have to contend with Mystra before that's a foregone conclusion.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_141.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_37.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_37.text: As for us, well... the future awaits.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_37.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_153.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_153.text: I swear, you ascend to unprecedented power one time and then suddenly everyone's doing it...
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_153.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_48.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_48.text: I do wonder how he'll fare when Mystra decides to crush him. It could be quite the show.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_48.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become a god

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_90.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_90.text: But enough about the wizard. Let's talk about us.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_90.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_23.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_23.text: I've never been on first-name terms with a god before. It could have its perks.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_23.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_81.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_81.text: I can't imagine Mystra will take it... lying down? Floating? However gods relax.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_81.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become a god

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_229.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_229.text: Still, good luck to him. I'm sure he'll go far.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_229.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_286.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_286.text: Once Gale tasted of godhood, he was always bound to fill himself full. May he be wiser than he is cocksure, for his own sake.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_286.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_203.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_203.text: After all, Mystra's not about to welcome him to the pantheon with open arms.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_203.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_94.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_94.text: For now, though - let us leave Gale to his future, and turn to our own.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_94.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_34.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_34.text: I shall miss him. Though I hope he proves to be a kindly god - I have had my fill of the tyrannical sort.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_34.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_358.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_358.text: Though I hope he has the mettle needed to face Mystra. She will not yield willingly, I fear...
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_358.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_348.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_348.text: A new chapter awaits - let us make haste.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_348.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_309.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_309.text: Another low mortal, grasping at godhood. Perhaps he will manage it, and be everything he promises - perhaps not.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_309.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_74.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_74.text: Better for the world not to find out at all, I think. And certainly better for Gale that Mystra does not.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_74.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_294.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_294.text: But he's set himself on his path. We have our own next steps to think on.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_294.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_106.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_106.text: And all to impress a former lover. Gale should do as Minsc did, and stop at the face tattoo.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_106.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_69.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_69.text: Mystra no longer wishes to share his bed. Boo doubts she will wish to share the mastery of all magic with him instead.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_69.context: NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_270.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_270.text: But, let the wizard wet his robes in the river, if that is his wish.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_270.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_280.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_280.text: I envy him. If we had dominated the brain, we would be greater than gods.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_280.context: NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_63.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_63.text: Perhaps one day the planes will quake as Mystra and Gale clash for control of the Weave. I would not bet against our wizard if it does come to pass.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_63.context: NodeContext: thoughtful - anticipating the prospect with some excitement

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_58.text: As it is, our future is uncertain, and we must face it without divinity, without our illithid powers, as mortals.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_58.context: NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_354.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_354.text: Don't do it, Gale. Stay here, with me.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_47.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_47.text: Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. You should give it to Mystra like she asked.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_207.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_207.text: Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. You should give the Crown to Mystra.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_289.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_289.text: The power of Karsus would be in my hands...

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_283.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_283.text: But what then? What would I do with it, once I have it?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_283.context: NodeContext: contemplation drawing a mental blank

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_291.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_291.text: Such power was not meant for mortals. Retrieve the Crown, and give it to Mystra, as she asked.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_235.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_235.text: Sage and timely counsel, as always. And I intend to heed it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_235.context: NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_31.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_31.text: A wise man learns from his mistakes, and strives not to repeat them. I shall bring the Crown to Mystra.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_284.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_284.text: She'll cure me of my affliction, and I'll finally be free.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_284.context: NodeContext: sure of himself - this is the right thing to do

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_85.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_85.text: Better yet, you'll be her Chosen again.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_176.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_176.text: And a more deserving one this time around.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_176.context: NodeContext: he'd genuinely forgotten about that and is just now remembering

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_320.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_320.text: Perhaps, or she might just reject you again.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_310.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_310.text: Regardless, it's the right thing to do. That's good enough for me.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_105.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_105.text: Why do you care what Mystra thinks? Keep the Crown and you could be a god.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_266.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_266.text: Ugh, no. Having seen what we've seen of those who chase godhood, I'm quite content with my mortality.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_145.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_145.text: You promised me that we would be gods together, Gale.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_155.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_155.text: I promise, you'll have your fill of divinity at my hands. And I at yours, I hope. But only in the metaphorical sense.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_134.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_134.text: Are you sure you're ready to give up such powers? You'll never have the chance again.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_212.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_212.text: If this adventure has taught me anything, it's that there are things in this world far more valuable than power.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_230.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_230.text: You, for example. You were always wiser than me when it mattered most.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_230.context: NodeContext: speaking to a loved one with great affection

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_364.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_364.text: Besides, I've grown quite fond of this merry band of ours, and I'd quite like to see what happens to it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_364.context: NodeContext: tonal shift towards levity the way British people do as soon as they've had an emotion

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_88.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_88.text: I'm sure Mystra will summon me soon enough, but until then, I propose we celebrate our victory the mortal way - with a drink in our hands, and reckless abandon in our hearts.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_326.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_326.text: Revelry? A grand notion - we've earned the right to an indulgence or two.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_326.context: NodeContext: surprised to hear Gale say it, but very much on board

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_173.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_173.text: But I leave the final call to our esteemed leader.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_261.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_261.text: I'm not sure about 'drink in hand', but I think we've all earned some reckless abandon.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_261.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_28.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_28.text: How about you? Any thoughts on what's next?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_332.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_332.text: I should probably skip the meal and nightcap, but by the gods, it would be good to rest.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_332.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] The game's over, time to go celebrate. Gale's suggested a nice meal and a nightcap.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_45.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_45.text: Boo wins the bet. Wizards are not entirely boring.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_327.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_327.text: Well, my friend? What do you say?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_302.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_302.text: Now you're talking. After all that, I think I'll need a drink in each hand, and a third on the table.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_302.context: NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_62.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_62.text: But I think right of choosing should fall to you. What'll it be?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_100.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_100.text: I'll see your 'reckless abandon' and raise you 'unrestrained hedonism'.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_100.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_156.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_156.text: What do you say? Because I think we've earned it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_325.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_325.text: We can do better than a nightcap, surely? A little hedonism, perhaps? Just a touch of debauchery?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_325.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] The game's over, time to go celebrate. Gale's suggested a nice meal and a nightcap.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_352.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_352.text: A nip, a dance, and a song? Don't mind if I do - I think we're due an evening's reprieve.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_352.context: NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_52.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_52.text: What's our leader have to say?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_15.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_15.text: I am seldom one to imbibe, but even I shall make an exception on a day like today.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_15.context: NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_125.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_125.text: I think we have earned it, no?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_288.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_288.text: That might be the smartest thing you've ever said, Gale.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_248.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_248.text: What do you think? Time for a quick one, before the work begins again?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_181.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_181.text: That's the wisest idea the wizard's had yet.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_117.text: What say you? I think we deserve a drink to celebrate surviving that horror.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_112.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_112.text: I'm sure a summons from Mystra will appear soon enough, but until then, I propose we celebrate our victory as mortals do best - with a drink in our hands, and reckless abandon in our hearts.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_228.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_228.text: Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. Perhaps you should give the Crown to Mystra.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_198.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_198.text: Perhaps with this offering, she'll finally cure me of the affliction of the orb.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_253.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_253.text: Wear it, and become a god?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_188.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_188.text: And what kind of god would I be?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_188.context: NodeContext: rhetorical question - he doesn't want to be a god

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_242.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_242.text: No kind the world will suffer for the absence of. And, I hope, there are plenty on mortal soil who would regret my absence.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_242.context: NodeContext: Glad to relinquish this particular ambition (godhood), and appreciating the bonds he's made on the journey

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_66.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_66.text: Perhaps it's best you leave it where it is. Lest anyone should ever again be tempted by such power.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_367.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_367.text: I fell to hubris once before and landed myself with this orb. I think I'd rather not make the same mistake again.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_367.context: NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_11.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_11.text: With the Crown in my hands, I would be unstoppable.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_11.context: NodeContext: excited by the prospect of power

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_246.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_246.text: And once I have, I'll take it to Mystra.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_246.context: NodeContext: feeling his way to a decision

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_8.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_8.text: If I salvage the stones, I could retrieve it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party. NodeContext: subtly excited

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_233.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_233.text: Perhaps that's the best place for it. Away from the meddling of mortals and Mystra alike.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_233.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party. NodeContext: accepting, at peace

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_285.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_285.text: It's not exactly the outcome Elminster hoped I would achieve, but it's the best I could do with the time his charm bought for me.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_285.context: NodeContext: justifying his peace out loud

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_13.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_13.text: I feel the faintest pricklings of hunger from the orb already. It will not remain under the sway of his spell forever.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_13.context: NodeContext: he knows his time on this earth might be limited, but isn't sad about it - just pondering what it means

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_306.speaker: Player
