CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_306.text: Who needs forever? Keep it fed and you've plenty of adventures still ahead of you.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_273.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_273.text: Ahead of us, I hope. I've a feeling we've many more adventures to come.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_258.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_258.text: But it's a journey I'd rather set out on with a good meal and a rest to my name. And a nightcap wouldn't go amiss.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_33.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_33.text: You should seek out Elminster. He might have a more permanent cure.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_333.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_333.text: A sound idea. It shouldn't take long to find him either - a wizard who cannot refrain from imparting his wisdom to the world... well, you know yourself how easy it is to find one of those.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_333.context:
NodeContext: the thought had crossed his mind perhaps but it's good to hear it affirmed by you
latter part is a joke about himself

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_304.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_304.text: You'll tell me if you're about to blow, won't you?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_255.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_255.text: Fear not - the orb is quite safe for the time being. I've a window in which to consider my options.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_73.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_73.text: Then we should make tonight count. After that, I fear you'll be too dangerous to stay with me.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_104.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_104.text: If you'd prefer me to follow my own course from here, I understand. I've no desire to put you, or what's left of this city at risk.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_104.context: NodeContext: trying to do the right thing - Hugh Grant style

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_76.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_76.text: You're content to leave the Crown where it lies? I'd have thought you'd want to claim it?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_150.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_150.text: If there's one thing I've taken from this adventure of ours, it's that some things are best left well alone. That Crown being one of them.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_65.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_65.text: Such a force of destruction deserves to rust in a watery grave. And I've no intention of diving down to salvage it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_217.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_217.text: No, all I want now is a meal, a rest, and perhaps a nightcap to round it all off.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_256.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_256.text: Gale, are you brooding? Because I swear, if you ruin my good mood...
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_256.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_139.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_139.text: Gale, please. This is not the time to be morosely lost in thought.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_139.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_328.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_328.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_290.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_290.text: What is it, wizard? There will be plenty to furrow our brows over in the morning - why not take a break?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_290.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_206.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_206.text: Why do you furrow your brow so, wizard? Boo says your abominable bat-cat has probably survived.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_206.context: NodeContext: 'Abominable bat-cat' = Tara, Gale's tressym. Minsc still does not fully trust her, but is trying to comfort Gale all the same

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_3.text: Wizard - was your brain entirely liquified during the battle? The fight is over, it's time to move on.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_124.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_124.text: I can see the cogs moving behind your eyes, Gale. What's on your mind?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_124.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_67.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_67.text: Gale? You seem distracted - does something trouble you?
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_67.context: NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_243.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_243.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_42.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_42.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_135.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_135.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_205.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_205.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have defeated three Chosen and a Netherbrain. You are miraculous, and you have earned the right to live.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_16.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_16.text: There should be no mind flayer roaming freely, not even you. Put yourself in prison.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_168.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_168.text: A ghaik with a conscience... remarkable. I would not have wished for such a fate for you, but perhaps it is for the best.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_168.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_362.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_362.text: *It will not be without sadness that you depart your friends, but at least they will be safe.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_375.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_375.text: *Perhaps there will be rats or other thoughtful vermin that you might sustain yourself on. Or, if you're lucky, a cellmate.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_194.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_194.text: *That is, all but one of them.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_271.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_271.text: I can't say I'm not a little thankful. You've been lucid for quite some time now, and from what I understand, you won't stay that way for long.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_271.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_287.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_287.text: Such nobility and self-sacrifice. I thought a mind flayer might have a stronger sense of self-preservation than that, but... well - goodbye.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_287.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_86.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_86.text: As long as you're not expecting anyone to follow you... I wish you all the best. Though I have a feeling you'll be just fine.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_86.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_195.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_195.text: You already made the greatest sacrifice for us. I cannot believe you are ready to make another, but I thank you for it.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_195.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_368.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_368.text: If you think iron bars will be enough to contain you, I fear you'll be in for a rather nasty shock. It's your mind that is your greatest asset, always has been. That's the one I'd watch.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_368.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_9.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_9.text: I cannot imagine the strength it must take to deny yourself access to the world. Your benevolence truly knows no bounds.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_9.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_183.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_183.text: Yet another noble sacrifice. If I didn't know you better, I would think you were just showing off.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_183.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_363.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_363.text: Do not be sad, mind flayer. Even out of sight, Boo will remember you. And I will make sure he reminds me to remember you also.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_363.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_307.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_307.text: Only cowards submit to slavery or imprisonment willingly. If you do not trust your own mind, you should have the courage to destroy yourself.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_307.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_335.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_335.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_39.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_39.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_186.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_186.text: *All living things that possess a mind are yours to manipulate, to consume. Even as you think the thought, you feel hungry.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_224.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_224.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_275.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_275.text: *And what of the orb? Will you still be able to control when it explodes when you can barely control yourself?*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_121.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_121.text: You're an illithid now - new worlds are yours to explore, for as long as you still live.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_249.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_249.text: *You could start with Oryndoll, and perhaps later, Glyth itself. The world is yours to uncover, its stories yours to tell.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_59.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_59.text: What does it matter? You're a mind flayer. This world is yours.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_331.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_331.text: The risk to others is too great. You will have to take your life. But somewhere far away from here.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_239.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_239.text: *Perhaps the Underdark. With your death, you might even eradicate others of your kind from the face of this realm.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_192.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_192.text: *Or not. Perhaps you are unique among illithid-kind. Perhaps you will retain enough of who you are to resist your nature.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_93.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_93.text: *A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_281.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_281.text: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_245.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_245.text: You finally have a chance to live. Embrace it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_72.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_72.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_82.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_82.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_91.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_91.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_218.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_218.text: Look at you. You're glorious. The greatest ally I could have wished for.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_218.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_365.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_365.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_374.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_374.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_359.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_359.text: There should be no mind flayer roaming freely, not even you. Put yourself in prison.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_250.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_250.text: I'm sorry you feel this is necessary... but I understand. You really are just like me.
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_250.context: NodeContext: Reacting with sadness to mind flayer player deciding to put themselves in prison

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_80.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_80.text: *It is not without sadness that you leave this world, but locked away, at least the people in it will be safe.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_234.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_234.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_138.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_138.text: You've been away too long and left too many books unread. Your library is calling.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_29.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_29.text: *Not to mention a comfy armchair, a roaring fire, and a glass of fine wine.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_278.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_278.text: *Waterdeep is waiting for you - it's time to go home.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_232.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_232.text: Seek out Elminster's counsel - perhaps there's still a way to stabilise the orb for good.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_2.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_2.text: *No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him. The only problem is - where to find him?*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_60.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_60.text: There are so many places you've yet to explore, and not much time left to see them. Better get started.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_201.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_201.text: *You've always been curious about Menzoberranzan - perhaps that would be a good place to start. And after that, Cormyr, or even the Feywild.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_25.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_25.text: Someone should write of your adventures. What better biographer can there be than you?

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_167.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_167.text: *You will be immortalised in legend - generations upon generations will celebrate the tale of Gale of Waterdeep - the wizard that defeated a Netherbrain.*

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_110.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_110.text: *You could stay, and help. Your considerable strengths would not be unwelcome in such an endeavour...*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_75.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_75.text: *...Or you could find some other place to deploy them. Some other purpose, some other cause more befitting a mind flayer.*
CombatOver_Nested_AfterGithLeave_75.context: InternalNodeContext: If recruited Karlach, go to: END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach. If not, go to: RomanceFates/SoloFates.

AD_FirstTurn_0.speaker: Orpheus
AD_FirstTurn_0.text: Remember, only an illithid can dominate the brain. Use the parasite - do it now!
AD_FirstTurn_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstTurn_1.speaker: The Emperor
AD_FirstTurn_1.text: Remember - only an illithid can dominate it. Use the parasite I gave you.
AD_FirstTurn_1.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstTurn_2.speaker: The Emperor
AD_FirstTurn_2.text: We need to reach the core of its will. Get as close as you can to the Crown, and cast the spell to compel it to submit.
AD_FirstTurn_2.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstTurn_3.speaker: Player
AD_FirstTurn_3.text: The Crown, up ahead - time to cast the spell again, and break its will.
AD_FirstTurn_3.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstTurn_4.speaker: Orpheus
AD_FirstTurn_4.text: We need to reach the core of its will. Get as close as you can to the Crown, and cast the spell to compel it to submit!
AD_FirstTurn_4.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstTurn_5.speaker: Player
AD_FirstTurn_5.text: Only an illithid can dominate the brain. It's time to use the parasite the Emperor gave us!
AD_FirstTurn_5.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_FirstTurn_6.speaker: The Emperor
AD_FirstTurn_6.text: I must reach the core of its will. Help me get close to the Crown so I can cast the spell to compel it to submit.
AD_FirstTurn_6.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_47.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_47.text: *The tension dissipates - your companions begin to relax. You feel the warmth of their relief, their joy, their peace in each other's company.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_74.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_74.text: *A new quiet settles. Without the blazing Hells inside you, you can finally rest. And listen for the new voice - the quieter voice - that sounds from within.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_15.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_15.text: *And in your own heart, the restless, biting sadness that burns within you - threatening to break.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach steps away from the others, unnoticed while they share in each other's jubilation.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_115.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_115.text: *You can make it 'til dawn. If you gather every bit of strength you have, you can survive the night. One last night to say goodbye. One last night to live.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_146.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_146.text: *You can make it 'til dawn. If you gather every bit of strength you have, you can survive the night. One last night to say goodbye. One last night to live.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_59.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_59.text: *This is the end of the line - the threshold where the others cannot follow. And you have no choice but to walk it - alone.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach, alone, walks off to one side (wherever she needs to be for END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach.) InternalNodeContext: Go to: END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_83.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_83.text: *Your skin now itches insufferably, as if covered in biting ants. You look, but see nothing out of the ordinary. Until...*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion looks at his hand, but sees nothing

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: While he's looking at it, Astarion's hand starts to smoke. He's being burned by the sun once again.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_140.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_140.text: *This is it. With the mind flayer's parasite dead, your time in the sun is over.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_27.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_27.text: Astarion. The light will burn you to a crisp if you don't get to shelter.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_16.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_16.text: *You flee, stumbling through blinding light, your skin intolerably hot.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion runs to escape the sun.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_75.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_75.text: *It's hard to say how you find shelter, but you manage it. Now all that's left to do is wait for the familiar embrace of night.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Astarion in the shade, panting, a little singed, relieved to have made it, fearful of the light.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_68.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_68.text: *For all its terrors, you missed it. Baldur's Gate is not a bad place for a vampire to live, to flourish. And flourish you will.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_131.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_131.text: Astarion - you're starting to crisp up! Get out of the sun!

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_7.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_7.text: Shit. Astarion, you need to get out of the light.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_122.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_122.text: I think it might be time for you to find a shadier spot, my friend. If I'm not mistaken, you're beginning to burn...

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_157.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_157.text: Astarion - the sun is burning you. To shelter, quick!

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_9.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_9.text: Astarion! Get out of the sun!
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_9.context: NodeContext: urgent, he hasn't noticed that he's begun to burn

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_35.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_35.text: Hide, Astarion! I do not think you are going to tan!

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_21.text: What is that enticing aroma? Ah - I do believe the sun is cooking poor Astarion.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_134.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_134.text: Oh no - Astarion, you're burning up. Take cover, quickly!

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_29.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_29.text: *Your thoughts wander from your companions and everything you endured to your own piteous fate.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_6.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_6.text: *If only you'd defied your Father when you had the chance, and freed yourself of your dark desires... but it's too late now.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_138.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_138.text: *Your destiny is set. Your very blood shall clot with the Urge, and that hungry desire will consume you.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_127.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_127.text: *You disobeyed the Lord of Murder. But his hold on you remains... It gnaws... You are hungry.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_114.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_114.text: *You may have freed the world from the control of the Netherbrain, but you are not yet free.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_123.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_123.text: *Your Father is angry. What foul punishment awaits you now that you have rejected him?*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_89.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_89.text: You are strong. You defeated a Netherbrain. Surely you can defeat the Lord of Murder?

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_76.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_76.text: Whatever it is, you deserve it.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_79.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_79.text: *And just like that, it's over. Whatever's left of you is subsumed by the overwhelming strength of your desires.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_37.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_37.text: You must be contained. You will go to prison, and ask for the strongest handcuffs they have.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_96.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_96.text: *Even now, your desires threaten to consume you. Your only hope is that a prison will be sufficient to contain you while you spend the rest of your life pondering your sins.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_137.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_137.text: *But it seems your Father has other ideas.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_14.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_14.text: This cannot be allowed to happen. One final act of resistance - kill yourself.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_1.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_1.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_90.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_90.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_69.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_69.text: Stop this right now. You have a life ahead of you - don't waste it!

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_11.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_11.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_19.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_19.text: *You've butchered so many before - each death a gift to your Father. But this one, you will take from him. This one is just for you.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge looks at the knife in contemplation. Stabs themselves multiple times (reuse if possible) once the narrator's line is done.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_119.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_119.text: *You've butchered so many before - each death a gift to your Father. But this one, you will take from him. This one is just for you.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge looks at the knife in contemplation. Stabs themselves multiple times (reuse if possible) once the narrator's line is done.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_2.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_2.text: *The blade feels cool as it pierces your flesh. There is no pain, only the need to sleep... sleep... sleep...*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player commits suicide. Same as Lae'zel suicide in node UUID 018f0315-9257-01ee-4186-465f40352502.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_145.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_145.text: What do you think you're doing?
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_145.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] alarmed that player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_86.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_86.text: What are you doing?! Stop it!
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_86.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_46.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_46.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_4.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_4.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_45.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_45.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_118.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_118.context: NodeContext: alarmed that the player mind flayer is killing themselves

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_92.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_92.text: It is as it should be. I hope you find peace.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_80.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_80.text: You are depravity compounded on depravity. You cannot be allowed to live. Take your own life.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_55.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_55.text: Their concerns are so trifling, are they not?
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_55.context: NodeContext: conspirational, just to player, telepathic

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_84.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_84.text: Look at you. You're glorious. The greatest ally I could have wished for.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_84.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_147.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_147.text: You know, this partnership doesn't have to end here... you and I could do wonderful things...
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_147.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_40.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_40.text: We could rebuild the Knights of the Shield and run it together. What do you say?
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_40.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_139.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_139.text: You go ahead. I want to do some good in the world.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_144.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_144.text: If you change your mind... you know where to find me.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_144.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_20.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_20.text: That sounds like a fine plan.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_78.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_78.text: To business, then. We have much to discuss...
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_78.context: NodeContext: telepathic between Emperor and player

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_26.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_26.text: We're mind flayers. We need to think bigger.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_73.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_73.text: *It's hard to say what your companions make of you now; their faces betray only confusion. Though one face is notably missing - Karlach.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_38.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_38.text: Have I ever told you how much I enjoy you? Lead the way...

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_58.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_58.text: There's only room for one mind flayer here. Eat its brain.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_5.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_5.text: *Chewy, cerebral, and delicious. Never in your life have you tasted something so delightful.*
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black on Emperor. Sounds of munching and brain-eating.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_142.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_142.text: *It's not as if you're doing anything wrong. Just following nature's plan.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_77.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_77.text: I'm - not sure. She's been through quite the ordeal. Perhaps she's in camp...

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_107.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_107.text: Perhaps she's retired to camp? She has had a long day.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_25.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_25.text: Camp, would be my guess. She - she doesn't have much time left.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_135.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_135.text: She's wandered off... Perhaps she just needs some time alone.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_104.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_104.text: No doubt she needs a moment alone with her thoughts. Who wouldn't, after all she's been through?

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_72.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_72.text: Our mind flayer acquaintance has wandered off. Not feeling quite herself, perhaps... Understandable.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_132.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_132.text: She has already lost her body to the tadpole... I hope she has not lost her mind. We should find her.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_28.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_28.text: *Her day has proven longer than most, but it's not over yet.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_8.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_8.text: Perhaps she has returned to camp. She has... much to think on.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_8.context: NodeContext: Wearily - referring to the fact that Karlach turned herself into a mind flayer to save us all

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_82.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_82.text: To camp, says Boo! She may have slipped into a new skin, but her scent still singes my hamster's nose.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_82.context: NodeContext: Trying to be enthusiastic - referring to the fact that Karlach has turned into a mind flayer to save us all

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_109.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_109.text: She returned to camp to rest - and to consider her fate. I fear Karlach is not long for this world.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_117.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_117.text: She said she needed some time to herself, and she'd meet us at camp. I'm not sure she's going to last much longer...

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_156.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_156.text: She must be at camp. I think she was getting a little too hot under the collar.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_156.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Comment on Karlach's overheating engine that's threatening to kill her

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_30.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_30.text: She's at camp, waiting for us. I - I don't think she'll be able to hang on much longer.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_71.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_71.text: I fear her time is running short...

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_64.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_64.text: She's taking the long route back to camp. Her time with us is running short - no doubt she's many thoughts to get in order.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_64.context: NodeContext: Talking about a companion who's about the

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_103.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_103.text: She is measuring out the last moments of her life. We should find her, and say our goodbyes.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_103.context: NodeContext: sad, contemplative. Speaking o fKarlach, who is dying.

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_121.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_121.text: *Her time is running short, and so too is your window to say goodbye.*

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_94.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_94.text: Back to camp. She will not have much time.
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_94.context: NodeContext: sudden urgency, realising Karlach has returned to camp to die

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_23.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_23.text: We must find her, before it is too late - to camp, quickly!
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_23.context: NodeContext: sudden urgency, realising Karlach has returned to camp to die

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_148.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_148.text: Hold on - we're a body short. Where's Karlach?

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_129.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_129.text: Hold a moment - where is Karlach?

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_3.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_3.text: We're short a tiefling - where is Karlach?

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_49.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_49.text: What of Karlach? I cannot lay eyes on her...

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_57.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_57.text: Now, Karlach - Boo still shivers from the sea. May he toast himself against your... Karlach? Where has she gone?
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_57.context: NodeContext: All the drama done, he turns to other matters as if simply moving on. Asking Karlach if Boo can heat himself on her furnace, before realizing she's not there

CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion_33.text: Hold - this gathering has become altogether too civilised. Where is Karlach?

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_23.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_23.text: It's done. The Netherbrain is defeated - along with the Grand Design, praise Mother Gith.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_23.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_10.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_10.text: *Almost as an afterthought, you notice you lost the powers Mizora gave you. But it doesn't matter anymore. You've never felt so potent.*
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll look himself over, feeling the eldrich energies leaving his body.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_2.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_2.text: I should feel relieved, yet my blood still simmers...

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_4.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_4.context: NodeContext: vocal equivalent of a sad smile

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_50.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_50.text: I saved the fucking world. And I think I might live long enough to tell the tale, too.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_35.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_35.context: NodeContext: vocal equivalent of a sad smile

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_54.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_54.text: I wish I'd made the sacrifice instead of you, Karlach.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_25.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_25.text: Don't worry about me. I'm... happy.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_34.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_34.text: *Against all odds, the Netherbrain is defeated. The day, won. The future of Faerûn, secured.*
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the bay where the brain sank.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_55.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_55.text: *All it took was becoming a mind flayer.*
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at front and back of their illithid hand.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_33.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_33.text: ...The parasite. It's withered, dead along with the Netherbrain. I am cleansed! I will never be a filthy ghaik.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_45.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_45.text: I can't feel the tadpole... they must have all died with the brain - that means we can't turn into mind flayers!
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_45.context: NodeContext: Realisation and delight - she's finally free of the parasite.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_39.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_39.text: And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_8.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_8.text: And we didn't even have to turn into mind flayers to do it!

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_0.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_0.text: Against all odds, we cured ourselves. Free from the parasite. Free from the prospect of ceremorphosis. I can hardly believe it. We will not become accursed illithids!

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_31.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_31.text: My mind is clear, its burden lifted. When the Netherbrain died, the tadpoles died with it.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_31.context: NodeContext: like waking up from a nightmare to a delightful reality

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_20.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_20.text: When the Netherbrain died, the tadpoles died with it. I'll never be some grotesque illithid!
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_20.context: NodeContext: like waking up from a nightmare to a delightful reality

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_7.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_7.text: The tadpoles must have died with the brain. The threat of ceremorphosis is no more.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_14.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_14.text: And the tadpoles have fallen silent, I take it? Good. A mind flayer wouldn't make for much of a heroic statue.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_15.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_15.text: And the worm squirms no more! Boo need not worry that his seat on my skull will grow suddenly stickier with mind flayer juice.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_15.context: NodeContext: Joyous - happily saying he will no longer turn into a mind flayer

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_43.text: And we are cleansed. The tadpoles are still, at last - they cannot control us, or turn us into abominations.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_16.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_16.text: We did it. The Netherbrain is dead.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_24.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_24.text: We're free of that stupid parasite. And I'm free to enjoy all the power Cazador left me.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_13.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_13.text: And I'm still standing in the sun. This is incredible! Maybe whatever it changed in me was permanent?

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_32.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_32.text: The city will cheer us - but it is the triumph itself, the very smiting of evil, that should lift our hearts.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_32.context: NodeContext: his nobility barely masking his joy at such triumph

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_58.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_58.context: NodeContext: Still in high spirits but Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_42.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_42.text: Hard to believe we have actually prevailed. But it is true.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_22.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_22.text: We've won, but at what cost? The mangled rhymes the bards will make of your name - perhaps those are the true evil here.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_22.context: NodeContext: Mock horror - actually willing to joke now the day has been won

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_59.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_59.text: Boo did not doubt us for a moment. Not during any of our many failures.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_59.context: NodeContext: Satisfied, taking in the scene of our victory

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_30.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_30.text: We are free. No more gods or monsters except those of our own making.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_36.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_36.text: My powers... they're draining. Just like Mizora said they would. A small price to pay, in the grand scheme of things.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_27.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_27.text: It's done. The Netherbrain is defeated - along with the Grand Design, Vlaakith be praised.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_27.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_49.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_49.text: Hells. I'm lucky I learned to swim when I did...
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_49.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_28.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_28.text: Ugh... should've learned to bloody swim. Can't believe I almost drowned at the last hurdle...
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_28.context: NodeContext: Spoken with a cough/splutter/weeze after nearly drowning

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_6.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_6.text: Ha! Victory! Our enemies are dust at our feet.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_29.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_29.text: I - I can't feel the tadpole. It's gone - we're free!

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_12.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_12.text: Take a moment, savour our victory. Long may the coastwinds carry our names.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_12.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_48.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_48.text: The loss of a mind is a terrible thing... but this time, I think I'll make an exception.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_48.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_1.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_1.text: We did it. We actually did it. And the city's still standing.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_1.context: NodeContext: Stunned relief. Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_38.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_38.text: The final blow has been struck. The battle is surely won.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_38.context: NodeContext: exhilarated, a little breathless - just killed a netherbrain, saw it sink into the river, swam to shore, and survived - all because you're a fricking hero

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_61.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_61.text: Well, this is a bigger mess than any we made in the old days. My congratulations.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_61.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, but appraising the ruined city skyline after we saved the city. She's not being sarcastic - actually impressed.

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_41.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_41.text: No, Boo - this moment is for savouring. There will be tadpoles to snack on later.
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_41.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a squeak from Boo. Stage whisper, a little harried - Boo's ruining what is meant to be a moment of reflection as you and the party stand and stare at the ruined - but saved! - skyline of Baldur's Gate

CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_StandardIntro_19.text: It is done - the Absolute eradicated, vengeance exacted.

FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Mind Flayer player looks at the massed thralls around and the fleet of nautiloids dotted across the skyline. They pulse out a psionic command to all.

FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar_2.speaker: Narrator
FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar_2.text: *This is but the first conquest. Every realm shall quake at your power. Every tongue shall speak your name in awe. Every god shall perish in your shadow. This world is yours. Now for the rest.*

FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: A tadpole vat floats/is wheeled into view, flanked by two mind flayers. It is placed before the kneeling masses. The glow from within the vat illuminates their faces. The mind flayer player gestures them to reach in. One NPC  does so, and withdraws her hand with a tadpole. She raises it towards her eye...

FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Time cut to: ranks of newborn mindflayers are now assembled, moving towards  the archways leading out of the city. Above the rooftops, a nautiloid rises into the sky.

FinalDecision_Nested_IllithidAvatar_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: High above, the mind flayer player is atop the Netherbrain once again. They watch as Nautiloids full of their new army rise upwards.

AD_CrownBeingDominated_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain_Helper
AD_CrownBeingDominated_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_ProtectCaster_0.speaker: The Emperor
AD_ProtectCaster_0.text: This is it - protect your illithid ally while they cast the spell!
AD_ProtectCaster_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_ProtectCaster_1.speaker: Orpheus
AD_ProtectCaster_1.text: This is it - protect your illithid ally while they cast the spell!
AD_ProtectCaster_1.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_ProtectCaster_2.speaker: Player
AD_ProtectCaster_2.text: This is it - keep the enemy away until the brain is completely subdued!
AD_ProtectCaster_2.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

EnterMind_0.speaker: The Emperor
EnterMind_0.text: It's weakened - this is our chance.
EnterMind_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain]
If Emperor was the one to cast Kharsus' Compulsion, it delivers the line then goes through the portal.

EnterMind_7.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
EnterMind_7.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Inside mind arena]
Shot of the brain chained, squirming against the chains that bind it.

EnterMind_8.speaker: Narrator
EnterMind_8.text: *Even bound, its will is stronger than anything you've ever felt - the chains shake, threatening to break at any moment.*
EnterMind_8.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain]
Shot of remaining party members suffering a mindmeld-type effect.

EnterMind_1.speaker: The Emperor
EnterMind_1.text: It's vulnerable, but not defeated. Use the portal - we will bring it down together.
EnterMind_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain, spoken as a voice in the party members' heads]

EnterMind_5.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
EnterMind_5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Inside mind arena]
The screen shakes with the force of the brain trying to break out from the chains.

EnterMind_3.speaker: Orpheus
EnterMind_3.text: It's vulnerable, but not defeated. Use the portal - we will bring it down together.
EnterMind_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain, spoken as a voice in the party members' heads]

EnterMind_10.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ElderBrain
EnterMind_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain, spoken as a voice in the party members' heads]

EnterMind_2.speaker: Narrator
EnterMind_2.text: *You feel it - a sudden shift - the brain is weakening, its grasp of itself slipping. This is your chance.*
EnterMind_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain]
If the player is the mind flayer that cast Kharsus' Compulsion, they go through a portal.

EnterMind_4.speaker: Orpheus
EnterMind_4.text: The brain is weakened - this is our chance.
EnterMind_4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [On top of brain]
If Orpheus was (a mind flayer and) the one to cast Kharsus' Compulsion, it delivers the line then goes through the portal.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_132.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_132.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_132.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Reflecting on her much earlier antagonism towards the githyanki

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_112.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_112.text: So. Lae'zel. Will you be joining them?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_112.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_8.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_8.text: *The time has come. You have thwarted the Grand Design. You can call out to the Astral - and ascend.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_17.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_17.text: Speak the Rite of Ascension. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_13.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_13.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to the Astral Plane. Your plea has been heard.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_104.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_104.text: *The red dragon appears, poised to carry you to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled at last.*
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_97.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_97.text: Is this farewell then? I'm glad we didn't end up killing each other - things would have been much duller, I'm sure.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_174.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_174.text: *You shiver, perhaps out of fear, excitement, elation - or all three.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_49.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_49.text: *In the distant reaches of your mind, Vlaakith calls out her eternal promise. You will know the names of the stars and the will of the cosmos. You will ascend.*
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off on the dragon and the scene is over.InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off, never to be seen again.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_27.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_27.text: *There is a great pause, as if the entire universe had gone quiet - and you know the truth.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_47.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_47.text: *You appear as an illithid. The kith'raki will hunt you, gut you, and devour you. You are not Vlaakith's precious, but Vlaakith's prey.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_153.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_153.text: *You are what you were taught to hate. The next choice is yours, and yours alone.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_115.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_115.text: Even without your queen's blessing, you have earned the right to survive.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_50.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_50.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_40.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_40.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_130.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_130.text: You will not live as your queen's reject. Take your own life.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_133.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_133.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_19.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_19.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted. She's about to kill herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_108.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_108.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, She's about to kill herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_28.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_28.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_123.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_123.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party. Urgent from Gale - sees what she's about to do.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_24.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_24.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock as you watch Lae'zel kill herself after the battle rather than become a mind flayer

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_16.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_16.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock as you watch Lae'zel kill herself after the battle rather than become a mind flayer

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_155.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_155.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_36.text: Lae'zel, no! You are destined for great things, child!
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_36.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_122.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_122.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_10.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_10.text: I suppose I should have foreseen this...

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_58.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_58.text: *The blade feels cool as it pierces your flesh. There is no pain, only the need to sleep... sleep... sleep...*
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel illithid player guts herself with a dagger as her companions look on in horror. The epilogue will go on without her.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_64.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_64.text: You need no one's blessing now. You have destroyed a Netherbrain. You will thrive.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_96.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_96.text: *The world is yours for the taking. A world you have made your own.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_89.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_89.text: *Vlaakith has rejected you, for Orpheus still lives. The kith'raki will hunt you, gut you, and devour you. You are not Vlaakith's precious, but Vlaakith's prey.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_161.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_161.text: *Your fate belongs to you, and you alone. What will you make of it?*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_151.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_151.text: You have found affection and more on this rock. Stay, and pursue a new life.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_73.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_73.text: *Vlaakith will call for your head and send the kith'raki. They will chase you to the ends of the many planes.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_67.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_67.text: *But you feel secure in your fate. You know there is something beyond ascension - companionship.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_6.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_6.text: I suspected you wouldn't be able to part from me. Looks like I was right.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_46.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_46.text: You have seen through Vlaakith's lies. Turn your back on your queen.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_139.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_139.text: *But you are now your own master. The world is yours for the taking. A world of countless possibilities.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_32.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_32.text: Vlaakith will reject your illithid form. Brace for a future beyond your queen.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_159.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_159.text: You have made allies and friends. Remain in Faerûn.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_56.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_56.text: The Netherbrain is dead. To slay a ghaik was my sworn duty. I must call out to Tu'narath - my ascension's at hand.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_158.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_158.text: I will join you. We triumphed together - I have earned the right.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_65.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_65.text: So you have. Now focus your mind, hear my words. I will speak the Rite.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_109.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_109.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to the Astral Plane. Lae'zel has spoken - and been heard.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_14.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_14.text: Red dragons, to carry us to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled!
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon flies in. Lae'zel and the player mount it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_69.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_69.text: Come. The dragons will know the way.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_100.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_100.text: *You shiver, perhaps out of fear, excitement, elation - or all three.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_106.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_106.text: *In the distant reaches of your mind, Vlaakith calls out her eternal promise. You will know the names of the stars and the will of the cosmos. You will ascend.*
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player and Lae'zel fly off on the dragon and the scene ends.|InternalNodeContext: The player and Lae'zel fly off on their dragons, never to be seen again.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_175.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_175.text: *There is a great pause, as if the entire universe had gone quiet - and the connection is severed. Lae'zel has failed Vlaakith; you will not ascend.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_43.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_43.text: Ascend, Lae'zel. Fulfil your duty to Vlaakith.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_41.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_41.text: Bah - you would deny Vlaakith's gift? Very well - while you fumble about on this rock, I will raise a silver sword in my queen's honour!

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_143.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_143.text: What makes you so sure Vlaakith will welcome you?

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_91.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_91.text: We have thwarted the Grand Design, and I have slain the traitor prince. My loyalty is beyond question.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_162.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_162.text: Silence now. I will speak the Rite of Ascension.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_152.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_152.text: We have thwarted the Grand Design. My loyalty is beyond question.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_117.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_117.text: Forget ascension. Stay here. Make your own way as your own master.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_38.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_38.text: I've suffered so many bruises, bore so many blows, all to earn Vlaakith's favour.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_26.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_26.text: Yet it's this vexing, excruciating, phenomenal world that I can't resist.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_165.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_165.text: Vlaakith will call for my head. The kith'raki will chase me to every corner of Toril.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_173.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_173.text: Let them. Now, I hunt prey on my own terms and spill blood of my choosing. I need not be ascended - for I am born anew.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_1.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_1.text: My purpose was ordained before I hatched. Vlaakith is the wind that bears me and the fire that warms me.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_78.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_78.text: You are an honourable ally. I thought I would carry you. In truth, you oft carried me. I won't forget it.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_18.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_18.text: Silence, now. I will speak the Rite.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_62.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_62.text: Vlaakith, ba na'zin. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_62.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_3.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_3.text: *You quiver in spite of yourself. Lae'zel's shouts to the Astral Plane, seeking an answer. And before long, she has one.*
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Orpheus defeated and Lae'zel not ceremo

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_134.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_134.text: A red dragon, to carry me to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled!
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragons flies in. Lae'zel mounts it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_82.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_82.text: *You look on as Lae'zel soars to an uncertain fate.*
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel flies off on her dragon|

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_138.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_138.text: *The air around you is eerily still, as if time itself had been momentarily stopped.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_86.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_86.text: Hear me, my queen! Vlaakith, ba na'zin. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_86.context: NodeContext: More urgently this time. VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_60.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_60.text: No, no, no! My Queen, I am worthy! Do not throw me into the darkness - I would see your face and know your light!
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_60.context: NodeContext: The most crushed she has ever been. Vlaakith has refused her ascension.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_48.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_48.text: Orpheus lives. Vlaakith has rejected me. I am Hshar'lak.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_48.context: NodeContext: The most crushed she has ever been. Vlaakith has refused her ascension. h-SHAR-lock. (Traitor)

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_42.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_42.text: I appear as an illithid. Vlaakith has rejected me. I am Hshar'lak.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_55.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_55.text: *A moment passes. Lae'zel's heat turns to ice.*

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_83.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_83.text: The kith'raki will chase me to each end of the Material Plane. I have no ally but my own blade.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_57.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_57.text: You also have me. That must count for something.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_157.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_157.text: Gith's spirit help me, but it does. We have thwarted the ghaik Grand Design. I have honoured my people, I have secured their future. My duty is fulfilled.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_137.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_137.text: You can make a home in Faerûn. The githyanki are not unknown in Baldur's Gate.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_35.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_35.text: Perhaps, once it's recovered from the Netherbrain's scourge. I could find allies here, at very least.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_54.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_54.text: I have thwarted the ghaik Grand Design. I have honoured my people, I have secured their future. our duty is fulfilled.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_171.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_171.text: Good luck. Sounds like you'll need it.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_116.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_116.text: A warrior never depends on luck - she depends on skill. And maybe a few good allies to keep her honest.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_95.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_95.text: I hope I can count you in that number.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_12.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_12.text: Dammit all, Lae'zel. How dare you get me punished for your misdeeds?

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_136.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_136.text: The queen's decision is made, and our fates are open. Gnash your teeth, shake your head, grunt all you want.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_147.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_147.text: We're all the better for it. Vlaakith is a liar and a slaver. She is not the way forward.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_70.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_70.text: Our way forward is open, true.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_181.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_181.text: We have thwarted the ghaik Grand Design. We have honoured our people, we have secured their future. Our duty is fulfilled.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_167.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_167.text: The past is done, and we face the future. Apart, we can survive. Together we can thrive.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_114.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_114.text: Forget ascension. Stay here. Make your own way as your own master.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_37.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_37.text: Forget ascension. Stay in Faerûn, with me.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_102.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_102.text: I saw something more for us, once. But you are ghaik. My path cannot be yours.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_59.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_59.text: Forget ascension. Stay here, with the one you care for.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_92.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_92.text: This is your decision, Lae'zel. Make it count.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_76.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_76.text: Then we will ascend to the Astral Plane together. Now focus your mind, hear my words. I will speak the Rite.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_125.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_125.text: You are right. My choice, my life. I will know true liberation.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_44.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_44.text: Well that's a pleasant sight. Here's hoping they stay in their own plane.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_44.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Watching dragons fly off, through a portal back to the Astral plane

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_129.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_129.text: Speaking of the Astral Plane - aren't you going to join them, Lae'zel?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_129.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_30.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_30.text: Now there's a sight to see. Not that I'll miss them... No offence.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_30.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Watching dragons fly off, through a portal back to the Astral plane

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_113.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_113.text: Speaking of githyanki, will you be joining them, Lae'zel?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_113.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_39.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_39.text: The githyanki are leaving us. An unlikely place to find ourselves, fighting on the same side as them.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_178.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_178.text: Speaking of githyanki, what will you do now, Lae'zel? Will you join them?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_178.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_140.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_140.text: The githyanki are departing in peace. A curious sight in a day already full of them.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_156.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_156.text: Speaking of githyanki, what about you Lae'zel? Will you be joining them?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_156.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_141.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_141.text: Lae'zel, will you be joining them?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_141.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_169.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_169.text: A reprieve from the githyanki invasion - for this day, at least.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_169.context: NodeContext: Watching githyanki rise and leave the city on their dragons

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_176.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_176.text: But what about you, Lae'zel, what will you do?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_176.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_81.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_81.text: See how the dragons flee you, Boo? Now they know you stand as this plane's protector.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_81.context: NodeContext: Watching githyanki rise and leave the city on their dragons

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_25.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_25.text: But Lae'zel is still here. Will you not join them?
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_25.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_128.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_128.text: The githyanki leave, at last. I feared they would make this world their own.

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_170.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_170.text: Will you go with them, Lae'zel? You would surely be heralded as a champion of your kind.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_170.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_2.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_2.text: Goodbye, dragon riders. I wish you the best - in your home plane, preferably.
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_2.context: NodeContext: wistful farewell as the githyanki leave this world to go back to their home in the Astral Seas

CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_61.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_VlaakithLaezel_61.text: What about you though, Lae'zel? What's your plan?

CombatOver_585.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_585.text: You - Orpheus. Abomination. You have served your purpose, now - you will die.

CombatOver_474.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_474.text: Do what you must. I cannot live in this skin any longer.
CombatOver_474.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kneels nobly, offering himself for death.

CombatOver_569.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_569.text: He sacrificed everything in order to save our lives, Lae'zel. That ought to count for something to you.

CombatOver_502.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_502.text: The Prince of the Comet has fallen. He sacrificed everything to stop the Grand Design. Does that mean nothing to you, Lae'zel?

CombatOver_241.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_241.text: He sacrificed his soul to save your people, Lae'zel. Surrendered his very being to prevent the Grand Design. I'd say it's a tad ungrateful to murder him for it.

CombatOver_407.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_407.text: He paid the ultimate price, to save our lives. That should count for something, Lae'zel.

CombatOver_243.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_243.text: He gave his life for ours, Lae'zel. You might give him the death he seeks without claiming it as some victory.

CombatOver_566.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_566.text: He asks for death, Lae'zel. I think he has earned a noble and a quiet one, yes?

CombatOver_653.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
