CombatOver_653.text: Do what you must, Lae'zel. But make it quick - we would have perished long ago without his protection.

CombatOver_387.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_387.text: Yes, put the poor beast out of its misery.

CombatOver_639.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_639.text: He gave up everything to save us, Lae'zel. Is this really the best you can offer him?

CombatOver_88.speaker: Player
CombatOver_88.text: He made the ultimate sacrifice to save our lives. Are you sure this is what you want, Lae'zel?

CombatOver_261.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_261.text: Save your sympathy. He is hshar'lak. Traitor, and ghaik.

CombatOver_181.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_181.text: You made a promise to me when we freed him, and I intend to hold you to it, as I hold myself bound to my Queen.

CombatOver_665.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_665.text: Though I may call you ally, I do not need your blessing to fulfil my duty.

CombatOver_563.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_563.text: It was my Queen's decree that he should die, and I intend to honour it.

CombatOver_674.speaker: Player
CombatOver_674.text: Orpheus, will you not fight back?

CombatOver_370.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_370.text: Lae'zel is right. I am an abomination, I feel it even now.

CombatOver_455.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_455.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel raises her sword/dagger to strike at Orpheus.

CombatOver_578.speaker: Player
CombatOver_578.text: Utter a blessing to Prince Orpheus, under your breath.

CombatOver_722.speaker: Player
CombatOver_722.text: Watch as Lae'zel fulfils her destiny.

CombatOver_85.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_85.text: It is done. A fitting death for a traitor.

CombatOver_624.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_624.text: To slay a ghaik was my sworn duty. To kill Orpheus was my privilege.

CombatOver_128.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_128.text: My people are leaving, and I must leave with them. I must call out to Tu'narath - my ascension's at hand.

CombatOver_776.speaker: Player
CombatOver_776.text: Stab her before her weapon strikes.

CombatOver_476.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs Lae'zel in the back (not shown). Player drops to the ground (leaving sword on the ground.)

CombatOver_638.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_638.text: You killed your ally to save a mind flayer? A poignant act, but a wasteful one.
CombatOver_638.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Laezel's body.

CombatOver_177.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_177.text: She was blinded by her faith, but true in her devotion.
CombatOver_177.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Laezel's body.

CombatOver_333.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_333.text: I remain an abomination. I cannot live like this.
CombatOver_333.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Laezel's body.

CombatOver_40.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_40.text: Even when my time in the Prism stretched out like eternity - when escape seemed impossible - I never lost hope.

CombatOver_439.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_439.text: I knew that my destiny was to liberate my people. To return to them triumphant.

CombatOver_524.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_524.text: It seems I can only fulfil one part of my destiny - my people will be liberated, but I cannot return to them. Not like this.

CombatOver_545.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_545.text: You helped me destroy that abomination. Now help me destroy myself. You must kill me.
CombatOver_545.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus gets down on one knee and holds out his sword. The player takes it.

CombatOver_597.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_597.text: But first, Lae'zel, I need your promise.

CombatOver_198.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_198.text: Carry my hope, carry my burden.  Call my dragons, Quulos and Quuthos, and ride to the Astral Sea. Destroy Vlaakith, release our people. Be our future and our legacy.

CombatOver_661.speaker: Player
CombatOver_661.text: I will slay Vlaakith and free our people. You have my promise, Orpheus.

CombatOver_607.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_607.text: You honour me. And now, you must give me the greatest honour - freedom from this form.

CombatOver_356.speaker: Player
CombatOver_356.text: It was on Faerûn that I learned how to be free. This will be my home.

CombatOver_438.speaker: Player
CombatOver_438.text: I won't. There's someone I care about. I will stay here, find my own way forward.

CombatOver_523.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_523.text: But first, Lae'zel, I need your promise.

CombatOver_499.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_499.text: Carry my hope, carry my burden.  Call my dragons, Quulos and Quuthos, and ride to the Astral Sea. Destroy Vlaakith, release our people. Be our future and our legacy.

CombatOver_530.speaker: Player
CombatOver_530.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_42.speaker: Player
CombatOver_42.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_767.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_767.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. How I long to say yes.

CombatOver_90.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_90.text: But you have chosen a path for yourself, and it does not lead to the Astral Plane.

CombatOver_76.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_76.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. You honour me.

CombatOver_26.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_26.text: Vlaakith will fall, and we will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

CombatOver_694.speaker: Player
CombatOver_694.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_320.speaker: Player
CombatOver_320.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_551.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_551.text: You understand, then. We will never be free while our people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

CombatOver_116.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_116.text: Vlaakith will fall, and we will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

CombatOver_309.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_309.text: La'ch cras'ht h'mak vlek! So be it. Now - give me my freedom from this form.

CombatOver_112.speaker: Player
CombatOver_112.text: You should do this, Lae'zel. Your people need you.

CombatOver_105.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_105.text: Duty... All my life, I've travelled in its slipstream, not once questioning its path. In its service, I came here. And now, in its service, I leave.

CombatOver_690.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_690.text: I will carry your hope, Prince Orpheus, and I will carry your burden. But to that burden I must add my own - the loss of those I leave behind.

CombatOver_549.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_549.text: It will be done. I will never be free while my people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

CombatOver_754.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_754.text: Enough talk - give me my freedom, freedom from this form.

CombatOver_487.speaker: Player
CombatOver_487.text: You have found new purpose here, with me. Stay here, and we'll find our own way.

CombatOver_369.speaker: Player
CombatOver_369.text: You sure you want to go straight into another war? Why not rest here in Faerûn for a while.

CombatOver_470.speaker: Player
CombatOver_470.text: You sure you want to go straight into another war? Why not rest here in Faerûn for a while.

CombatOver_114.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_114.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here that I learned what it meant to be adored, to be free.

CombatOver_571.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_571.text: Then my destiny is undone. Until someone can take up my cause, the githyanki will remain chained.

CombatOver_784.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_784.text: I found freedom, and then lost myself to this horror for nothing. All that remains is to die.

CombatOver_481.speaker: Player
CombatOver_481.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay in Faerûn, craft a new fate.

CombatOver_286.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_286.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here, with you, that I learned what it meant to be free.

CombatOver_565.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_565.text: Yes - I will stay. My destiny is for neither Vlaakith nor Orpheus to decree. It is mine.

CombatOver_335.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_335.text: I have already chosen a way - the way of Orpheus. Vlaakith will fall, and I will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

CombatOver_659.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_659.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

CombatOver_483.speaker: Player
CombatOver_483.text: You sure you want to go straight into another war? Why not rest here in Faerûn for a while.

CombatOver_706.speaker: Player
CombatOver_706.text: This is your choice to make, Lae'zel, not mine. I entrust it to you.

CombatOver_766.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_766.text: Then you will come with me, and we will destroy the lich queen together.

CombatOver_338.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_338.text: Duty... All my life, I've travelled in its slipstream, not once questioning its path. In its service, I came here. And now, in its service, I leave.

CombatOver_156.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_156.text: Do it quickly. I cannot live in this skin a moment longer.
CombatOver_156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kneels before the player as a mind flayer.

CombatOver_106.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_106.text: *You promised your Queen you would do this.*

CombatOver_687.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_687.text: *To slay a ghaik was your sworn duty, to execute Orpheus will be an honour indeed. You will surely ascend, and ascend in glory.*

CombatOver_337.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_337.text: *But the rebel prince is the only reason you are still alive. It was his power that protected you from the Netherbrain. Does he deserve to die?*

CombatOver_789.speaker: Player
CombatOver_789.text: Get up, Orpheus. For what you've done, you deserve to live.

CombatOver_621.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_621.text: I will not be ghaik! I did what I did to save my people.

CombatOver_695.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_695.text: The revolution against Vlaakith will come. Perhaps some day you might see truth, Lae'zel, and join it.

CombatOver_358.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_358.text: I trust that our people will have their freedom, but now I must have mine. Release my soul to the Astral Seas, while I still have one to call my own.

CombatOver_555.speaker: Player
CombatOver_555.text: Give Orpheus the honourable death he craves.

CombatOver_205.speaker: Player
CombatOver_205.text: Say what you will - I have no intention of killing you.

CombatOver_443.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_443.text: Then I will do once more what must be done.

CombatOver_357.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_357.text: It was an honour to fight beside you to end the Grand Design.

CombatOver_151.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kills himself plunging his sword into his stomach, and speaks his last words from a kneeling position before collapsing

CombatOver_726.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_726.text: *Prince Orpheus is gone. But the githyanki's future has not died with him.*
CombatOver_726.context: InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel avatar agreed to fight for Orpehus, not illithid

CombatOver_763.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_763.text: *Your heart flutters with excitement as you call out for the dragons. The Astral Plane awaits, and a rebellion takes shape. Your rebellion.*
CombatOver_763.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Dragon flies in and Lae'zel mounts it.|

CombatOver_567.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_567.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. May the dark lady guide your blade.

CombatOver_204.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_204.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. I'm a better person for having met you.

CombatOver_362.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_362.text: Lae'zel, darling - there never was one so delicious as you. Until we meet again.

CombatOver_291.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_291.text: Good-bye Lae'zel, fiercest of warriors. My heart remains yours, always.

CombatOver_541.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_541.text: Go forth, Lae'zel, to distant realms. I will miss you dearly.

CombatOver_257.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_257.text: Goodbye, Lae'zel. You've been absolutely unforgettable.

CombatOver_170.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_170.text: Fly on, Lae'zel. May the Oak Father preserve you and guide you true.

CombatOver_82.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_82.text: *The future of the Githyanki Empire rests in your hands. And you know just how to mould it...*
CombatOver_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel flies off on the dragon.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel avatar flies off. Cue epilogue without her.

CombatOver_352.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_352.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Dragons fly in and player and Lae'zel mount them.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel companion, player agreed to join her in Orpheus fight

CombatOver_743.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_743.text: *Your heart flutters with excitement, aspiration, and even - hope. The Astral Plane awaits, a rebellion takes shape.*

CombatOver_397.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_397.text: *The future of the Githyanki Empire rests on your shoulders. Battle awaits - and you mean to rise victorious.*
CombatOver_397.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player and Lae'zel fly off together.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel and player fly off on their dragons. Cue epilogue without them.

CombatOver_716.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_716.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Dragon flie in and Lae'zel mounts it.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel companion

CombatOver_422.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_422.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. Without you, I wouldn't have known warmth - only ice and fire.

CombatOver_202.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_202.text: I can never forget you. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

CombatOver_164.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off on a dragon.

CombatOver_107.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_107.text: A fitting death for a traitor.

CombatOver_136.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_136.text: *Prince Orpheus is dead. With his death, Queen Vlaakith's glory is secured, and so is your own.*

CombatOver_453.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_453.text: He was as noble in spirit as he was in bloodline. We're in his debt.

CombatOver_540.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_540.text: Well, that was a kindness. Can you imagine living like that? Urgh.

CombatOver_144.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_144.text: He really did give everything for his people - and for us. I hope he finally knows peace.

CombatOver_760.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up to transition to GithAreLeaving

CombatOver_664.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_664.text: A brave and noble prince. May the stories of his sacrifice travel far and wide.

CombatOver_345.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_345.text: A kinder fate than to live as one's sworn enemy, though no less a pity for it. At least in legend, the Prince of the Comet will live forever.

CombatOver_450.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_450.text: He did not hesitate. A true sacrifice, and a noble spirit. May his spirit find its way home.

CombatOver_255.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_255.text: Imprisoned most of his life, and he freely gave what little remained to save his people. Rare, that a hero actually lives up to their prophecy.

CombatOver_248.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_248.text: The princeling deserved a better end than this. We shall remember him, Boo.

CombatOver_392.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_392.text: We would not have survived any of this without him. May he find peace.

CombatOver_702.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_702.text: As noble in death as he was in life. His sacrifice will not be forgotten.

CombatOver_606.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_606.text: The rest is up to them. Someone else must rise within the ranks to lead the revolution against Vlaakith.

CombatOver_725.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_725.text: Give me my freedom from this form, release my soul to the Astral Seas while I still have one to call my own.

CombatOver_222.speaker: Player
CombatOver_222.text: Give Orpheus the honourable death he craves.

CombatOver_698.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_698.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player kills Orpheus. He thanks them with his dying breath, and slips into a peaceful death.|

CombatOver_104.speaker: Player
CombatOver_104.text: You may not be able to return to your people, Orpheus. But you deserve to live to see their future.

CombatOver_208.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_208.text: Perhaps you are right. I may not be the one to lead my people, but I can still bear witness to their glory.

CombatOver_285.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_285.text: I shall find a place for myself in a corner of these realms, for even in darkness, the stars of Tu'narath will shine upon me.

CombatOver_201.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_201.text: His people are lucky to have such a noble prince. I hope manages to adjust to his new way of life.

CombatOver_234.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_234.text: I'm glad the gith prince is taking his fate so well. I'd be devastated if I was that ugly.

CombatOver_685.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_685.text: He seems to be taking his new, monstrous form pretty well. Maybe he is worthy to be the gith's prince.

CombatOver_490.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_490.text: Never have I known a prince more noble. I hope he can find peace.

CombatOver_194.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_194.text: Freedom is freedom, no matter the form. I hope he finds peace with his newfound nature - it's the least he deserves.

CombatOver_677.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_677.text: His people are blessed to have him as their prince. I just hope he finds peace in his new form.

CombatOver_473.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_473.text: Homecomings are never easy. I fear Orpheus will find the githyanki much changed - and they him.

CombatOver_622.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_622.text: The githyanki will find they have a noble prince in Orpheus. If they do not slaughter him on sight, at least.

CombatOver_327.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_327.text: He does not deserve to be an outcast. I hope he finds peace, wherever he makes his home.

CombatOver_532.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_532.text: You mean well, but you do not understand.

CombatOver_432.speaker: Player
CombatOver_432.text: You're a mind flayer, but you're still you, aren't you?

CombatOver_696.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_696.text: My mind screams. It will never stop until it has slipped away from me entirely.

CombatOver_152.speaker: Player
CombatOver_152.text: Kill him. Give him the honourable death he craves.

CombatOver_411.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_411.text: It's all right. I knew what I was doing.

CombatOver_663.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_663.text: I will ensure that all githyanki know your name - and your sacrifice. What you have done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.

CombatOver_449.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_449.text: With their lost prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to you - the illithid who defied a Netherbrain.

CombatOver_433.speaker: Player
CombatOver_433.text: I still think we should have made Orpheus become a mind flayer instead of you, Karlach.

CombatOver_246.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_246.text: Don't worry about me. I'm... happy.

CombatOver_372.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_372.text: I saved the fucking world. And I think I might live long enough to tell the tale, too.

CombatOver_172.speaker: Player
CombatOver_172.text: Good luck to you, Prince Orpheus.

CombatOver_494.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_494.text: I thank you, my liberator, my saviour.

CombatOver_538.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_538.text: *He may have no reason to thank you, yet. You promised your Queen that you would end him. Now that the Netherbrain is defeated, the moment is yours.*

CombatOver_456.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_456.text: *He may have no reason to thank you, yet. Now that the Netherbrain is defeated, the moment is yours.*

CombatOver_615.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_615.text: *Kill Orpheus, and you will ascend. Let him live, and you will never know Vlaakith's honour. You will be hshar'lak - traitor to your people, traitor to your Queen.*

CombatOver_463.speaker: Player
CombatOver_463.text: Kill Orpheus. Fulfil your duty to Vlaakith.

CombatOver_368.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_368.text: And there I was, thinking the killing was over.

CombatOver_237.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_237.text: The last death of the day, I hope. Your duty is fulfilled.

CombatOver_707.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_707.text: The depth of your commitment to your cause truly knows no bounds. For him to have survived a Netherbrain only to be ended by your hand... well, it is an end, I suppose.

CombatOver_739.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_739.text: I cannot say I understand the reason for his death, but nature will reclaim him all the same.

CombatOver_101.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_101.text: A decisive end to the one whose powers protected you. I hope whatever you gain from his sacrifice is worth it.

CombatOver_84.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_84.text: Boo is conflicted. He liked Orpheus, but he likes you more, and killing him seems to have made you happy.

CombatOver_272.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_272.text: He served his purpose. And you have served yours.

CombatOver_215.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_215.text: He helped to kill a Netherbrain, only to be slain by one of his own... extraordinary.

CombatOver_263.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_263.text: He helped to kill a Netherbrain only to be slain by one of his own - a little unnecessary, don't you think?

CombatOver_183.speaker: Player
CombatOver_183.text: Orpheus is the only reason you are alive. He will not die by your hand.

CombatOver_504.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_504.text: Save your thanks, traitor. They are hardly worth the breath you waste to speak them.

CombatOver_630.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_630.text: You are blinded by your loyalty, child. Still, I cannot blame you. A false queen's lies may yet ring true to honourable ears.

CombatOver_130.speaker: Player
CombatOver_130.text: Don't worry about me. I feel more powerful than ever.

CombatOver_220.speaker: Player
CombatOver_220.text: It's all right. I like what I've become.

CombatOver_593.speaker: Player
CombatOver_593.text: That was very insensitive of you.

CombatOver_623.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_623.text: I will ensure that all githyanki know your name - and your sacrifice. What you have done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.

CombatOver_603.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_603.text: *Can your people really celebrate you in such a form as this? Your sworn duty was to slay a ghaik, not become one.*

CombatOver_16.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_16.text: *And you promised your Queen that you would slay Orpheus, not return him.*

CombatOver_120.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_120.text: *If you slay him now, would it be enough to convince Queen Vlaakith to ascend you, even as an illithid?*

CombatOver_292.speaker: Player
CombatOver_292.text: Your fate matters not. Kill Orpheus. Fulfil your duty to your people and your Queen.

CombatOver_59.speaker: Player
CombatOver_59.text: Let Orpheus live. You are already damned.

CombatOver_253.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_253.text: *Orpheus was supposed to die by your hand.*

CombatOver_748.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_748.text: The fire will rage, but you will not be there to see it. The Astral Seas have no place for you, hshar'lak.

CombatOver_705.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_705.text: I sense the fire rages fiercest in you, Lae'zel. I cannot blame you. Our queen has blinded you for too long.

CombatOver_330.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_330.text: You dare speak ill of my Queen? I will end you, Orpheus.

CombatOver_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel raises her sword/dagger to strike at Orpheus.

CombatOver_512.speaker: Player
CombatOver_512.text: Watch as Lae'zel fulfils her destiny.

CombatOver_755.speaker: Player
CombatOver_755.text: Stab her before her weapon strikes.

CombatOver_373.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player plunges their own dagger into Lae'zel. She drops her weapon in surprise, and falls to her knees.

CombatOver_134.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_134.text: Even as she would have struck me down, I cannot celebrate this child's death. Her devotion to her queen was without fault. It was Vlaakith who failed her.

CombatOver_31.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_31.text: With their lost prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to you - the illithid who defied a Netherbrain.

CombatOver_732.speaker: Player
CombatOver_732.text: My work here is not done yet. I have greater ambitions I have yet to achieve.

CombatOver_631.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_631.text: You have aided me in achieving my ambitions, I wish you well in yours.

CombatOver_730.speaker: Player
CombatOver_730.text: The best illithid in all the land. Make sure your people know that.

CombatOver_168.speaker: Player
CombatOver_168.text: I'd rather be remembered for who I was before.

CombatOver_399.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_399.text: And I must leave with them.

CombatOver_359.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_359.text: I shall not speak of Lae'zel's final act. Her story will be written as it was before - a warrior, who ended the Grand Design.

CombatOver_688.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_688.text: Lae'zel. Some will look at you and see an abomination. But I see something else. A revolutionary.

CombatOver_544.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_544.text: Come. We will free the githyanki and dismantle the empire. Let them be imprisoned no longer!

CombatOver_646.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_646.text: *The hope in his voice is sincere, fervent even. But in spite of your desire to believe him, you know the truth. You are ghaik. You will not be welcome in the Astral Sea, and nor will he.*

CombatOver_193.speaker: Player
CombatOver_193.text: I will take up your cause. Together, we will vanquish Vlaakith for good.

CombatOver_416.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_416.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. May the dark lady guide your blade.

CombatOver_644.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_644.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. I'm a better person for having met you.

CombatOver_629.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_629.text: Lae'zel, darling - there never was one so delicious as you. Until we meet again.

CombatOver_385.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_385.text: Good-bye Lae'zel, fiercest of warriors. My heart remains yours, always.

CombatOver_618.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_618.text: Go forth, Lae'zel, to distant realms. I will miss you dearly.

CombatOver_277.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_277.text: Goodbye, Lae'zel. You've been absolutely unforgettable.

CombatOver_518.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel and Orpheus fly off on their dragons. Same animation as N285 but without the spoken line.|

CombatOver_45.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_45.text: *The future of the githyanki rests in your hands. And you know just how to mould it.*

CombatOver_704.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_704.text: Fly on, Lae'zel. May the Oak Father preserve you and guide you true.

CombatOver_54.speaker: Player
CombatOver_54.text: It was on Faerûn that I learned how to be free. Go on without me - this will be my home.

CombatOver_322.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_322.text: I will not say I'm pleased with your choice - but I will wish you many fortunes. Whatever may come, you are still T'lak'ma Ghir - Sister in Freedom.

CombatOver_50.speaker: Player
CombatOver_50.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.

CombatOver_689.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_689.text: *The world is yours for the taking. A world you have made your own.*

CombatOver_554.speaker: Player
CombatOver_554.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?

CombatOver_312.speaker: Player
CombatOver_312.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.

CombatOver_8.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_8.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

CombatOver_497.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_497.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

CombatOver_29.speaker: Player
CombatOver_29.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

CombatOver_613.speaker: Player
CombatOver_613.text: There's someone I care about. I will stay here, find my own way forward.

CombatOver_64.speaker: Player
CombatOver_64.text: I cannot return to our people. Not like this...

CombatOver_6.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_6.text: Come, Lae'zel. We will free the githyanki and dismantle the empire. Let them be imprisoned no longer!

CombatOver_68.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_68.text: Come, Lae'zel. We will free the githyanki and dismantle the empire. Let them be imprisoned no longer!

CombatOver_520.speaker: Player
CombatOver_520.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_236.speaker: Player
CombatOver_236.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_226.speaker: Player
CombatOver_226.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_751.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_751.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. How I long to say yes.

CombatOver_750.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_750.text: But you have chosen a path for yourself, and it does not lead to the Astral Plane.

CombatOver_305.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_305.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. You honour me.

CombatOver_132.speaker: Player
CombatOver_132.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

CombatOver_427.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_427.text: An illithid ally... it would be most unorthodox... but advantageous...

CombatOver_179.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_179.text: T'lak'ma Stil - Friend in Freedom. I welcome you to the fight.

CombatOver_360.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel pulls the player up onto the dragon

CombatOver_498.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_498.text: Come, both of you. The future begins.
CombatOver_498.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player, Orpheus, and Lae'zel fly off on the two dragons.|

CombatOver_103.speaker: Player
CombatOver_103.text: Your duty is to your people, Lae'zel. Go with Orpheus, and lead them to freedom.

CombatOver_542.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_542.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. Without you, I wouldn't know warmth - only ice and fire.

CombatOver_213.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_213.text: I can never forget you. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

CombatOver_744.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_744.text: Until recently, I'd never felt the regret of an unwanted farewell. And now, I feel it double.

CombatOver_581.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_581.text: I say farewell to a lover. And I say farewell to you, a staunch ally and... friend.

CombatOver_668.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_668.text: Chk - then stay, turn your back on your people. But you will never truly be free while our people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

CombatOver_123.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_123.text: Be gentle, Lae'zel. Who are we to offer freedom's fruits, only to refuse our own kin a taste?

CombatOver_684.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_684.text: It will be done. I will never be free while my people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

CombatOver_343.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_343.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

CombatOver_140.speaker: Player
CombatOver_140.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay in Faerûn, craft a new fate.

CombatOver_586.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_586.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here, with you, that I learned what it meant to be free.

CombatOver_626.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_626.text: Orpheus - I'll remain here. My destiny is for neither you nor Vlaakith to set. It is mine alone.

CombatOver_509.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_509.text: I will not say I'm pleased with your choice - but I will wish you good fortunes. Whatever may come, you are still T'lak'ma Ghir - Sister in Freedom.

CombatOver_51.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon lands. Orpheus mounts it.|

CombatOver_210.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_210.text: *Easy indeed, for some to leave. But others - you - have one more threshold to cross.*

CombatOver_491.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_491.text: I have already chosen a way - the way of Orpheus. Vlaakith will fall, and we will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

CombatOver_539.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_539.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

CombatOver_61.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Two dragons land. Lae'zel mounts one, and Orpheus mounts the other.|

CombatOver_612.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_612.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel and Orpheus fly off on their dragons.|

CombatOver_471.speaker: Player
CombatOver_471.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay with me, let us craft a new fate.

CombatOver_627.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_627.text: It... it's not meant to be. You are ghaik. As noble as you are, this is a threshold I cannot cross.

CombatOver_728.speaker: Player
CombatOver_728.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay with me, let us craft a new fate.

CombatOver_482.speaker: Player
CombatOver_482.text: No. You have found new purpose, Lae'zel. You can craft a new fate here, with your partner.

CombatOver_218.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_218.text: Yes. Yes. Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here that I learned what it meant to be free.

CombatOver_70.speaker: Player
CombatOver_70.text: This is your choice to make, Lae'zel, not mine. I entrust it to you.

CombatOver_329.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_329.text: Then you will come with me, and we will destroy the lich queen together.

CombatOver_63.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_63.text: You are right. My choice, my life. I will know true liberation.

CombatOver_245.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_245.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here that I learned what it meant to be free.

CombatOver_756.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_756.text: Then I must go with the Prince. I will never be free while my people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

CombatOver_435.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_435.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

CombatOver_692.speaker: Player
CombatOver_692.text: I couldn't have done it alone - remember my friends, when you remember me.

CombatOver_714.speaker: Player
CombatOver_714.text: Let it be known to all your people - not all mind flayers are alike.

CombatOver_143.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_143.text: They have endured an age of darkness and tyranny, though most did not know it. When my war against Vlaakith is done, everything will change.

CombatOver_129.speaker: Player
CombatOver_129.text: To be honest, I wish I'd made you do it.

CombatOver_406.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_406.text: It is understandable that you regret this... horror you have endured. But you made the right choice - my people need their prince.

CombatOver_43.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_43.text: *She may have succeeded, but you... Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

CombatOver_723.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_723.text: *The threat of the Grand Design is over, but your people will never accept you back into their embrace.*

CombatOver_252.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_252.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*

CombatOver_553.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_553.text: *Your friends and enemies alike are ripe for manipulation, and if not manipulation, then consumption.*

CombatOver_628.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_628.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*

CombatOver_590.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_590.text: *Or not. Perhaps you are unique among illithid-kind. Perhaps you will retain enough of who you are to resist your nature.*

CombatOver_367.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_367.text: *A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*

CombatOver_426.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_426.text: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*

CombatOver_531.speaker: Player
CombatOver_531.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.

CombatOver_511.speaker: Player
CombatOver_511.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?

CombatOver_281.speaker: Player
CombatOver_281.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.

CombatOver_274.speaker: Player
CombatOver_274.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

CombatOver_475.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_475.text: *What happens next will be by your design, and yours alone.*

CombatOver_157.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_157.text: *They may have succeeded, but you... Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

CombatOver_737.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_737.text: Tsk'va - you may have succeeded, but I have failed. Gith's son is dead, and Vlaakith has abandoned me.

CombatOver_382.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_382.text: I will be hunted by her Inquisition to the ends of the world.

CombatOver_224.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_224.text: I must leave. I have nothing more to gain by being here.

CombatOver_389.speaker: Player
CombatOver_389.text: You have me. Stay for me.

CombatOver_142.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_142.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy, I wish...

CombatOver_122.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_122.text: No, I will not hesitate - this is my home. My destiny is for neither Vlaakith nor Orpheus to decree. It is mine.

CombatOver_525.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_525.text: We've shared so much together. I wish...

CombatOver_12.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_12.text: But you are ghaik. As noble as you are, this is a threshold I cannot cross. This is where our fates diverge.

CombatOver_386.speaker: Player
CombatOver_386.text: You have found someone important here. Stay for them.

CombatOver_127.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_127.text: Perhaps - perhaps yes. Without them, I wouldn't have known warmth, only ice and fire.

CombatOver_745.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_745.text: Perhaps there is a future here...

CombatOver_429.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_429.text: Yes - I will stay. My destiny is for neither Vlaakith nor Orpheus to decree. It is mine.

CombatOver_680.speaker: Player
CombatOver_680.text: We faced a Netherbrain together and won. Doesn't that mean anything to you?

CombatOver_96.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_96.text: You helped my people end the Grand Design - for this, I will remember you. But I will not forget what you have cost us.

CombatOver_73.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_73.text: I will remember the fights we fought together, but my next fights will be without you.

CombatOver_401.speaker: Player
CombatOver_401.text: Good luck, Lae'zel. I hope you find what you're looking for.

CombatOver_719.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_719.text: The world looms before me - never has it felt so vast, and so empty. But at least it will be a world in which there is no Grand Design.

CombatOver_109.speaker: Player
CombatOver_109.text: You have me. Please stay. For me.

CombatOver_117.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_117.text: It will be a restless life, while the false queen reigns over my people. But a life, nonetheless - and a free one.

CombatOver_299.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_299.text: We fought well together. I will gladly fight with you again. If not the Astral Seas, then here, and wherever else we go.

CombatOver_543.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_543.text: It was under your watch that my Prince was slaughtered.

CombatOver_10.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_10.text: You had the means to free Orpheus, but you chose not to.

CombatOver_506.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_506.text: I watched you consume his mind.

CombatOver_228.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_228.text: It is true you helped me end the Grand Design. But the path you chose has cost my people greatly. I will thank you, but I will not stay for you.

CombatOver_604.speaker: Player
CombatOver_604.text: You have me. Please stay. For me.

CombatOver_317.speaker: Player
CombatOver_317.text: I wish I'd done it instead of you.

CombatOver_7.speaker: Player
CombatOver_7.text: Don't worry about me. I feel more powerful than ever.

CombatOver_412.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_412.text: I have crossed blades with countless warriors among the Tears of Selûne. But none so resilient as you.

CombatOver_729.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_729.text: This wouldn't have been possible without you. We'd all be the thralls of that thing, or worse. Instead, we're free.

CombatOver_161.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_161.text: Before we met, some hailed me as a saviour, some as a legend. But now, I've seen the face of true heroism: yours.

CombatOver_364.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_364.text: If it wasn't for you, we'd be thralls, dead, or who knows. This is your victory.

CombatOver_124.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_124.text: This victory would not have been possible without you. I will never forget that.

CombatOver_301.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_301.text: They'll write stories of this, of course - each fable sprouting more falsehoods than the last. But for that one seed of truth: you. You did this.

CombatOver_24.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_24.text: I will be serious for a moment. Often Minsc speaks for his hamster, but now he speaks from his own heart, too - thank you. You saved us.

CombatOver_121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_121.text: Without you, the brain would have enthralled me again. I would rather die... I owe you everything.

CombatOver_46.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_46.text: Although credit where it's due - you were a worthy ally up there. If not for you, that brain may have bested us.

CombatOver_686.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_686.text: And credit where credit's due - you saved us. You saved this whole city.

CombatOver_425.speaker: Player
CombatOver_425.text: It's all right. I like what I've become.

CombatOver_605.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_605.text: And rightly so. You are better now than you've ever been.

CombatOver_178.speaker: Player
CombatOver_178.text: That was very insensitive of you.

CombatOver_703.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_703.text: Ignore them. You are better now than you've ever been.

CombatOver_379.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_379.text: Only mild offence intended. You did us a great service - and I'm grateful for it.

CombatOver_505.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_505.text: It makes little difference to me.

CombatOver_187.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_187.text: I did what I had to to secure my freedom.

CombatOver_485.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_485.text: And in spite of your resistance to completing your evolution - you have proved a good ally.

CombatOver_454.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_454.text: And in spite of your resistance to evolution - you have proved a good ally.

CombatOver_271.speaker: Player
CombatOver_271.text: We could not have done it without your help.

CombatOver_681.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_681.text: I'm glad you think so. I did my best.

CombatOver_734.speaker: Player
CombatOver_734.text: You didn't give me much choice.

CombatOver_519.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_519.text: I am no more responsible for your actions than you are for mine.

CombatOver_562.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_562.text: No offence meant, of course. I can never forget what you did for us, for the city.

CombatOver_559.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_559.text: Not to cast any slight on you, of course. Your form rather suits you.

CombatOver_672.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_672.text: Of course, no slight intended towards your form.

CombatOver_125.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_125.text: Only mild offence intended, of course. You did the unthinkable - and I'm grateful for it.

CombatOver_733.speaker: Player
CombatOver_733.text: I saved the world. The sacrifice was worth it.

CombatOver_94.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_94.text: I won't disagree. Chk - did you think I would?

CombatOver_587.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_587.text: Although - well, better you than me.

CombatOver_679.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_679.text: I'm glad you see it too. Baldur's Gate will never forget what you did - what we did.

CombatOver_749.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_749.text: Well, I'm certainly glad you feel that way - I doubt I could be so forward-thinking, in your place. Thank you.

CombatOver_22.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_22.text: You gave up so much so that others could walk free. I know sacrifice - and I must honour yours.

CombatOver_697.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_697.text: You won't hear a syllable of disagreement from these lips. Thank you.

CombatOver_147.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_147.text: I believe so. Once the din of battle has faded, we will truly know what has been saved today.

CombatOver_113.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_113.text: A simple creed to spout. A harder one to live by.

CombatOver_115.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_115.text: You wear the flayer's face, and yet your noble soul has not fled before it! I do not know if Boo or I would have your courage.

CombatOver_710.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_710.text: I doubt the world will appreciate your sacrifice. More likely, it will fear and shun you. But you have my thanks, for whatever they are worth.

CombatOver_376.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_376.text: I won't argue. I know - I can barely believe it myself. I will carve your name and deeds in tir'su, forever etched in slate.

CombatOver_311.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_311.text: Everyone owes you, in truth. I'll see that all of Lady Shar's children know of their tentacled champion.

CombatOver_184.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_184.text: Everyone owes you, in truth. And I'll be sure they know of their debt.

CombatOver_405.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_405.text: Do I? Well I'm sure we can work something out.

CombatOver_769.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_769.text: For once I will happily admit it - I do. I owe you everything.

CombatOver_488.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_488.text: No question. The people will sing psalms praising your name - and my voice will be the loudest among them.

CombatOver_650.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_650.text: Have a ponder on what your prize shall be then. I'm still a touch winded from it all...

CombatOver_410.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_410.text: As does everyone. I have little doubt your efforts will be rewarded in whatever way you see fit.

CombatOver_632.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_632.text: Myself and the Coast entire. A debt I'm unlikely to repay in the years left to me, but I suppose I can make the effort.

CombatOver_712.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_712.text: Minsc and Boo would recommend a statue on the Wide, but it is not always the honour it seems.

CombatOver_294.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_294.text: The whole world owes you, but expect their fear rather than their gratitude. You have my thanks though, for whatever they are worth.

CombatOver_740.speaker: Player
CombatOver_740.text: I did what I had to do.

CombatOver_395.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_395.text: You faced impossible choices. You made the right one. Few would have the nerve.

CombatOver_149.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_149.text: Not just that - you did what no one else was capable of. Thank you.

CombatOver_738.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_738.text: Indeed you did - I'll make sure the plebs of this city know who they should thank for their continued existence.

CombatOver_363.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_363.text: Baldur's Gate will never forget it. And neither will I.

CombatOver_527.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_527.text: You gave up so much so that others could walk free. I know sacrifice - and I must honour yours.

CombatOver_165.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_165.text: Oh, spare me the modesty. They should erect statues to you... though they may frighten children.

CombatOver_72.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_72.text: So modest of you. Indeed, the mighty oak need not boast of its branches.

CombatOver_577.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_577.text: A simple creed to spout. A harder one to live by.

CombatOver_552.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_552.text: You wear the flayer's face, and yet your noble soul has not fled before it! I do not know if Boo or I would have your courage.

CombatOver_48.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_48.text: And yet it was you who did it. The world will not thank you - it will fear you - but you have my gratitude, for whatever its worth to you.

CombatOver_699.speaker: Player
CombatOver_699.text: It's all right. I like what I've become.

CombatOver_484.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_484.text: You are ghaik. By all accounts, I should hate the very sight of you. But I know the heart that beats within. It belongs to a warrior.

CombatOver_267.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_267.text: Good! You should always be comfortable in your own skin. Even if that skin is new and... glistening.

CombatOver_673.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_673.text: You do...? Well... all the better then, I suppose.

CombatOver_788.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_788.text: I must confess, there's a certain dignity to it. The grand champion wearing an unholy skin.

CombatOver_58.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_58.text: I like it too. Mucous suits you. And you saved us all.

CombatOver_500.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_500.text: I'm glad. Being comfortable in one's own skin is key to happiness, I find.

CombatOver_189.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_189.text: You 'became' nothing. I suspect you were always the self-sacrificing sort.

CombatOver_133.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_133.text: Strange. But perhaps when I see your enemies cower at your feet, trembling, I will envy you.

CombatOver_259.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_259.text: As does Minsc. We are both misshapen in our own ways, but Boo loves us still.

CombatOver_649.speaker: Player
CombatOver_649.text: That was very insensitive of you.

CombatOver_188.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_188.text: Have you ever known me to be sensitive?

CombatOver_645.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_645.text: I... I suppose it was. Apologies - I've just been waiting a long time to have the inside of my head to myself.

CombatOver_97.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_97.text: Apologies. I just got swept up in - well - surviving.

CombatOver_214.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_214.text: Was it? A thousand apologies. You are a legend, and no accusation or aspersion can diminish you.

CombatOver_192.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_192.text: Apologies. A slip of the tongue from an overjoyed comrade. Not a drop of malice meant.

CombatOver_283.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_283.text: My heartfelt apologies. I meant no disrespect to your sacrifice.

CombatOver_390.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_390.text: I have never been known for my tact, but honesty is the better virtue by far. So, sincerely - thank you.

CombatOver_32.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_32.text: You are right. The shame bubbles deep in my gut, as Boo will bear witness to.

CombatOver_384.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_384.text: Not that there's necessarily anything wrong with being a mind flayer, of course...

CombatOver_513.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_513.text: I would say no offence meant, but... well. Look at you.

CombatOver_741.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_741.text: Oh, eh - sorry. I didn't mean to... well, you know.

CombatOver_657.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_657.text: No offence meant, of course. I can never forget your sacrifice for us, for the city.

CombatOver_731.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_731.text: Not to cast any slight on you, of course. Your present form is but a sign of your gallantry.

CombatOver_53.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_53.text: Of course, no slight intended towards your new form.

CombatOver_388.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_388.text: Ah. Well. Perhaps I speak with too much haste.

CombatOver_349.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_349.text: Ah, forgive Minsc. It has been said that his mouth sometimes frolicks in fields far ahead of his mind.

CombatOver_617.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_617.text: Although in your case, the transformation may be an improvement.

CombatOver_254.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_254.text: You did it. You destroyed the Netherbrain, and ended the Grand Design.

CombatOver_442.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_442.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kneels in gratitude before the player.

CombatOver_365.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_365.text: *The Netherbrain is destroyed, the Grand Design reduced to dust. And you are forever changed.*

CombatOver_610.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_610.text: *Your mind flexes, your body ringing with the afterglow of power, daring you to resist, daring you to feel anything but authority.*

CombatOver_727.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_727.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

CombatOver_547.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_547.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have failed your queen.*

CombatOver_735.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_735.text: *The engine inside you is silent. You will live, in this strange new form.*

CombatOver_436.speaker: Orpheus
CombatOver_436.text: It's done. The Netherbrain destroyed, the Grand Design ended.

CombatOver_86.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_86.text: *Almost as an afterthought you notice you lost the powers Mizora gave you. But it doesn't matter anymore. You've never felt so potent.*
CombatOver_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll look himself over, feeling the eldrich energies leaving his body.

CombatOver_466.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_466.text: It's done. The brain is defeated. We're - free.

AD_EnemyEmperor_3.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EnemyEmperor_3.text: By will or by force, you will join us.

AD_HurryUp_0.speaker: The Emperor
AD_HurryUp_0.text: I need to reach the Crown and cast the spell to compel it to submit. We must dominate the brain!
AD_HurryUp_0.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_1.speaker: Orpheus
AD_HurryUp_1.text: Go quickly now - get to the Crown and cast the spell! We will keep the enemy at bay.
AD_HurryUp_1.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_2.speaker: Orpheus
AD_HurryUp_2.text: Dominate the brain - now! Or all is lost!
AD_HurryUp_2.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_3.speaker: The Emperor
AD_HurryUp_3.text: Press on - get to the Crown, cast the spell. Do not let these enemies distract you.
AD_HurryUp_3.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_4.speaker: Orpheus
AD_HurryUp_4.text: The enemies just keep coming... Hurry!
AD_HurryUp_4.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_5.speaker: The Emperor
AD_HurryUp_5.text: The enemies are still coming - make haste!
AD_HurryUp_5.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_6.speaker: Orpheus
AD_HurryUp_6.text: These forces are just a distraction - I must reach the Crown, cast the spell, and dominate the brain!
AD_HurryUp_6.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_7.speaker: Player
AD_HurryUp_7.text: Do it - dominate the brain. NOW!
AD_HurryUp_7.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_8.speaker: Player
AD_HurryUp_8.text: These forces are just a distraction - I have to dominate the brain!
AD_HurryUp_8.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_9.speaker: Player
AD_HurryUp_9.text: Get to the Crown, and cast the spell. We'll see off the enemies!
AD_HurryUp_9.context:
NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

For Karlach: 'IG-not' her own word for idiots

AD_HurryUp_10.speaker: The Emperor
AD_HurryUp_10.text: We must dominate the brain. NOW.
AD_HurryUp_10.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

AD_HurryUp_11.speaker: Player
AD_HurryUp_11.context: NodeContext: Effort/strain - party can feel the Netherbrain's influence as they draw near it

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_45.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_45.text: *You could stay, and help. Your considerable strengths would not be unwelcome in such an endeavour...*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_225.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_225.text: *At least you would not be alone... as long as Karlach, despite her change, stays Karlach.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_139.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_139.text: *At least you would not be alone... if only Karlach's heart were healed.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_15.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_15.text: *At least you would not be alone... if only you knew where Karlach was.*
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player notices Karlach is gone. InternalNodeContext: Go to: END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_206.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_206.text: We honour the fallen. Starting with Gale.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_206.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_164.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_164.text: We raise a glass to Gale. Perhaps the Elfsong still stands?
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_164.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_133.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_133.text: I suppose we'd better honour Gale - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar and a room full of virgins.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_133.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_145.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_145.text: I suppose we'd better honour Gale, - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar...
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_145.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_233.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_233.text: We honour Gale. A plaque perhaps, or better yet a statue.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_233.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_135.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_135.text: We should honour the wizard's sacrifice. I shall plant a forest in his name.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_135.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_24.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_24.text: We can spare more than a moment for Gale. And more than one drink.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_24.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_70.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_70.text: We will drink for Gale. Boo and I are banned from most of the inns in the city, but you may order for us.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_70.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_180.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_180.text: We should claim whatever's left of the Elfsong as spoils, and drink it dry. We will raise the first glass to our memories of Gale.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_180.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_198.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_198.text: *Rest, rejoice, and remember Gale - the wizard who sacrificed himself to save the world.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_1.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_1.text: A quick rest, and then - to work. There's a lot of good a mind flayer could do in this world, and I intend to do it.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_179.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_179.text: Then let us hope your intentions remain as they are and do not undergo any further corruption.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_71.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_71.text: We've certainly benefited from your gifts. It stands to reason that others may do so also.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_54.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_54.text: How wonderful, but do try not to limit yourself. You've just saved the world, now is not the time to become boring.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_72.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_72.text: Just remember who your friends are, will you? In case you start to become... well, you know, hungry.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_11.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_11.text: It seems you've found peace with yourself - I'm glad. Just as long as your intentions remain as pure as they are now.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_41.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_41.text: Your intellect will be valuable indeed. So long as it remains uncorrupted.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_19.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_19.text: I can't pretend to understand your ambitions, or what drives them, but I wish you well.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_36.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_36.text: Were it any other mind flayer, I would put an end to this right now. But - I suppose you have earned the benefit of the doubt.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_203.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_203.text: Boo thinks you are very wise. He only wishes to remind you that his brain - while vast - would not make much of a meal.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_87.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_87.text: As long as you have no designs on my mind, I do not much care what your intentions are.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_87.context: NodeContext: emphasis on 'what' - dismissing a former ally who has become a mind flayer and claims to have 'good' intentions

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_35.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_35.text: I'll stay in the city. The world could use a mind flayer with good intentions. And a mind flayer's intellect.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_97.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_97.text: It's true. Whatever benefits one illithid could bring will only be doubled when there are two.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_259.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_259.text: I'm a mind flayer. I'll do whatever I please.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_173.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_173.text: Fine. But do not let your guard down, even for a moment. Any hunter worth their blade seeks an illithid head as a trophy.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_83.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_83.text: I can't guarantee you a warm welcome in the city, but should you find me, you'll have a seat at my table.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_38.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_38.text: Then we'll both be carving our own paths. I wish you well in yours.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_10.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_10.text: And so long as it doesn't please you to munch on my cerebellum, I'll be right behind you.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_90.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_90.text: Easier said than done, I fear. You may find yourself welcome in some circles... but set upon in far more.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_47.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_47.text: As you should, you have earned the right.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_16.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_16.text: As long as it's still you in there, and you haven't completely lost your mind.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_254.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_254.text: By all means, go and live however you wish. As long as we don't get in each other's way, I'm sure all will be well.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_254.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Mind Flayer Player just said "I'm a mind flayer, I'm gonna go do whatever I want"

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_266.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_266.text: At this point, you've earned it. Just don't start any grand designs, and I'm sure we'll all stay friends.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_266.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Mind Flayer Player just said "I'm a mind flayer, I'm gonna go do whatever I want"

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_221.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_221.text: And so long as they remain your wants, and not those of any hivemind - I wish you well.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_221.context: NodeContext: Considering. She should object to this, but it's not a terrible idea.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_249.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_249.text: Minsc and Boo will be keeping many eyes on you. For friendship, of course - and to be sure you sup only on sinful brains.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_149.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_149.text: I think it's best I find somewhere to go into hiding.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_132.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_132.text: A wise decision. You will not be welcome here, no matter what miracles you perform.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_115.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_115.text: Far from the fate you deserve for the sacrifices you have made, but... I understand.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_119.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_119.text: A poor reward, considering the sacrifices you made. But I understand. May Lady Shar bless you.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_119.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH remained loyal to Shar

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_57.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_57.text: A poor reward, considering the sacrifices you made. But I understand.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_236.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_236.text: It's not so bad in the dark. Only about half of the Baldurian sewers are active.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_75.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_75.text: You are braver than I could ever dream to be. I hope we will meet again, on a cloudy night.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_270.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_270.text: It's unfair. All you've done for me, for the Sword Coast - only to be forced into the dark. I'll miss you dearly.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_27.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_27.text: It's far from the fate you deserve for the scale of your sacrifice, but I understand why you feel the need to do it.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_252.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_252.text: You deserve so much better, but alas... I understand. Do as you must.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_32.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_32.text: To hide your face from the city you saved. You see now why this hero's business is not all story and song.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_32.context: NodeContext: Grimly sad for us - but she thinks we'll understand her general begrudgery about being called a 'hero' now.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_213.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_213.text: It is an injustice, that those you saved will not see the goodness behind an evil face. But Boo and I - we will visit!
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_213.context: NodeContext: First part said darkly, displeased at the ingratitude Baldurians would show the player in mind flayer form. Second part bright and excited

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_131.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_131.text: I fear you must. These people are too short-sighted to recognise a saviour in an unfamiliar form.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_9.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_9.text: Let's get out of this city. The Underdark calls to me...

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_153.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_153.text: The Underdark has its violent charms. I might just pay you a visit once you're settled.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_112.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_112.text: It's not for everyone, but it is a wise choice for you.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_166.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_166.text: You have much to learn about yourself in your new form, and the Underdark will prove a fitting nursery.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_211.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_211.text: *There was always going to be a moment when your sacrifice caught up with you. A threshold beyond which you would have to venture alone. This is that moment.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_199.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_199.text: *You are a mind flayer, after all. You will have the rest of your long years ahead to understand what that means.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_210.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_210.text: *Meanwhile your allies have rather inferior plans of their own.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_29.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_29.text: The Underdark? As much as I appreciate its shadows, I think Lady Shar will have use for me elsewhere...
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_29.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. (Arc: SH remained loyal to Shar)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_271.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_271.text: The Underdark? I've had my fill of lurking in the shadows, if it's all the same.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_50.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_50.text: The Underdark? You poor thing. I have a palace, you can sleep on one of a hundred couches until you're on your feet.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_182.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_182.text: The Underdark? Now that's a thought. Just not to the Drow - they don't treat pretty boys too kindly. Or any boys at all, really.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_169.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_169.text: The Underdark is a popular option. Just try to avoid the vampire spawn - I can't promise they'll be as friendly as yours truly.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_169.context: NodeContext: [Good path Astarion] Mind Flayer Avatar says they'll go live in the Underdark, where the party released a whole load of Vampire Spawn

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_107.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_107.text: Answer it, then - but you'll be going without me. I'm sorry.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_96.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_96.text: The Underdark? Not exactly on the top of my list, but I think I understand why the idea appeals to you.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_49.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_49.text: The Underdark? All part of nature's creation, of course, but perhaps not its most hospitable corner, after all we've been through...

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_129.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_129.text: Then you must answer. But far more deadly terrain awaits me here. Home.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_129.context: NodeContext: not liking the idea to go the underdark

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_134.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_134.text: I am not sure it is a call that Boo can answer.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_187.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_187.text: It calls to me too, but I can never return. I have executed enough heretics in my time to know what horrors await an exile from Lolth.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_105.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_105.text: I think a celebration is in order.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_43.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_43.text: A wise choice, ra'stil, perhaps the wisest you've ever made.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_235.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_235.text: Let's not forget the wine - I want to flush out my brain, just to be completely sure the tadpole's gone.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_245.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_245.text: A celebration, yes. And perhaps a drink, too.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_227.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_227.text: Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. It's been so long since I've had a fine wine. And we have more than earned it.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_2.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_2.text: Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. I won't imbibe, but I'll be happy to be away from here, and in your company.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_113.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_113.text: Excellent. Let's see if the Elfsong's still standing. Their Golden Sands Brew goes down real easy.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_238.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_238.text: We should drink. Perhaps there's an inn still standing. Every drop will be well-deserved.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_37.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_37.text: Very well. Perhaps after a drink or five I'll be tempted to inflict some of my singing on you all - as if the city has not suffered enough.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_234.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_234.text: There is much to do, but... a drink might be nice. A seat would be better.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_76.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_76.text: Heroically spoken! We must find an inn. Minsc has been banned from his share of ale-halls, but I am sure you and Boo can speak for me.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_219.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_219.text: I agree. We should claim whatever's left of the Elfsong as spoils, and drink it dry. By rights, half the city belongs to us.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_25.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_25.text: I wouldn't mind a very well-earned libation, myself.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_121.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_121.text: We should stay in the city. Help to rebuild it.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_137.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_137.text: I much prefer bloodletting to bricklaying. Hunt prey with me by night, and I will build with you by day.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_144.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_144.text: I will not be joining you. I fear my presence will be no more welcome in the streets of the city than it ever was.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_175.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_175.text: Every ghaik is an abomination. Maybe you're an exception. Maybe.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_205.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_205.text: *Now that you no longer live in each other's minds, it's hard to tell if the mind flayer is being sincere.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_46.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_46.text: *Though perhaps no harder than it ever was.*
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_46.context: InternalNodeContext: Loads of banches converge to this point

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_69.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_69.text: I honestly don't mind what we do, once we get - ow!
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flinches, as if a bug bit him on the hand. The sun is starting to burn him, although Astarion doesn't realise yetNodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Full line: "once we get off this beach"

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_94.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_94.text: What the - oh no. Oh gods.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at his hand, which is starting to smoke. Realises his time in the sun is up.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Realising your time in the sun is up. Sad, sullen

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_261.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_261.text: Well... it was nice while it lasted.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_261.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at his handNodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] resigned, you're losing the greatest gift you've ever had. Also a little in pain.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_99.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_99.text: Argh! I'm sorry, I - I have to go!
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: now that the tadpole's gone, Astarion has started to burn in the sunNodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Without the tadpole's protection the sun is really starting to burn, you have to run for shade before it becomes too much

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_258.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_258.text: Call him man or call him monster, but Astarion was a force against the Grand Design. He deserves to bask in the sun, not to hide in darkness.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_258.context: InternalNodeContext: A few banches converge to this point

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_33.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_33.text: Poor Astarion. How he loved the sun - if only the feeling was mutual. I hope that isn't the last we see of him.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_33.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_110.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_110.text: Astarion! Gods, what a horror, to feel the sun on your skin for so long, only to be forced back into the shadows.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_110.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic, horrified (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_267.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_267.text: Astarion! Cured of one affliction, only to be reclaimed by another. The sun is no longer a friend to him, but we must be - he'll need more solace than shadows can provide.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_267.context: NodeContext: Calling out to him, then speaking to those nearby. Pitying, but determined to help

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_42.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_42.text: A cruel blow - Astarion loved feeling the caress of the sun... only now it gouges him with its claws. Perhaps we shall meet again, beneath a shield of darkness.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_42.context: NodeContext: sympathetic/referring to Astarion after he's fled from the sun

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_77.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_77.text: Be well, Astarion. Hide while you must - but do not think your city is done with you just yet.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_77.context: NodeContext: Quietly to herself - to Astarion's retreating back as he flees the sunlight

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_80.text: Astarion is cursed to flee the sun as I am cursed to walk in it. Do not belittle him with pity - he is a survivor, and will thrive upon what bounty the darkness provides. There is life in him yet.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_80.context: NodeContext: Hint of pity, but she thinks Astarion got the better side of the deal. She's confident he'll be okay.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_18.speaker: Karlach
