CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_18.text: Astarion. Burnt by the sun again. Godsdamn, that's fucking cruel.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_148.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_148.text: *Astarion never let the darkness swallow you. You know that although he heads to the shadow, together, both your souls are all the lighter.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_260.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_260.text: *Astarion chased away your moments of darkness. You have no doubt that after all you've fought together, you will find him again.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_239.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_239.text: *Darkness once more swallows Astarion - but you will find him again, as you always do.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_191.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_191.text: *Darkness once more swallows Astarion. Without Cazador's lurking presence, perhaps he will find comfort there now.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_226.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_226.text: *Darkness once more swallows Astarion - with the lurking grasp of Cazador still reaching towards him.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_189.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_189.text: That's the last of Astarion the sun will ever see. May he fare well in the dark.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_189.context: InternalNodeContext: A few banches converge to this point

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_269.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_269.text: It seems that's the end of Astarion's love affair with the sun. That'll be hard on him...
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_269.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_248.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_248.text: Astarion will keep to the dark now, I wager. At least... he'll find plenty to feast on.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_48.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_48.text: I suppose that's the last time any of us will see him, and the last time he'll ever see the sun.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_161.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_161.text: He will sorely miss that freedom, I sense. It may be quite some time before we see him again.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_222.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_222.text: I doubt we'll ever see that face basking in the sun again.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_222.context: NodeContext: Referrring to Astarion running from the sunlight, his immunity gone

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_156.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_156.text: We will find you, Astarion! AND BOO WILL BRING A SUNFLOWER!
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_156.context: NodeContext: Calling out after Astarion, trying to comfort him after he's had to flee the sun - he lost his immunity for a noble act

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_241.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_241.text: I almost envy him. While he retreats into shadow, I prepare for my long exile on the surface.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_159.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_159.text: Back to the shadows. But perhaps not forever. Even though worst affliction can be fixed - with some amount of sacrifice.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_162.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_162.text: *Astarion's days in the sun are behind him. The best you can hope is that he finds darkness, and the comfort it once gave him.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_176.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_176.text: *Knowing him, he probably will. Comfort was always one of his specialties. Especially when it was his own.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_4.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_4.text: *You feel a gentle tingling on your skin - a faint prickle that starts to spread across any exposed flesh.*
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_4.context: NodeContext: Player Astarion starts to burn in the sun

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_30.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_30.text: Astarion - the sun's already begun to take its toll on you. Truly, I am sorry.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_39.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_39.text: It looks like basking in the sun is no longer an option for you, Astarion. You'd better find some shade.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_39.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_82.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_82.text: Hells - Astarion. The sun's already begun to scorch you.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_130.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_130.text: The sun is no longer your friend, then. A freedom you shall sorely miss, I feel.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_34.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_34.text: You'd best seek shelter, Astarion, and quickly. The world owes you - but the sun feels no such debt.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_34.context: NodeContext: Referrring to Astarion beginning to burn in the sun now he gave up his immunity. Gentle, but urgent - he gave up a lot, and it's not fair.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_58.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_58.text: Astarion...? Boo says you are beginning to smell like a festival-day feast...
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_58.context: NodeContext: Note of gentle, friendly warning - Astarion is starting to smoke in the sun

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_190.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_190.text: Now, without wishing to cause undue alarm, might I suggest we find some shade? I think the sun is reneging on that truce of yours.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_200.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_200.text: You are beginning to blister, spawn. Best scurry back to the shadows.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_126.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_126.text: You're burning up, soldier. Take cover!

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_8.speaker: Narrator
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_8.text: *Your days in the sun are behind you. The best you can hope for is that you find darkness, and the comfort it once gave you.*

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_152.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_152.text: Now - all of Toril, spread before me. A million marks to make, a million battles to fight.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_102.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_102.text: I may not belong to this land, but now, it belongs to me.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_73.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_73.text: A lot of people died so we could get to this moment.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_147.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_147.text: Let's go find somewhere to offer them a toast.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_265.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_265.text: Although I suppose there is a lot to do here - power to consolidate, a palace to claim. It will take time.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_31.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_31.text: But first, you and I are going to find the most hedonistic establishment in this city, and we are going to have a night that will go down in legend.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_251.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_251.text: After everything, I think I've earned it.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_7.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_7.text: Lest we forget - there are still graves to dig, injured to thank, warriors to exalt.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_21.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_21.text: They carved our course. Honour them with each and every step you take.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_3.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_3.text: There are many heroes' graves that will need to be dug. Many eulogies to be written.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_178.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_178.text: Let's honour them each and all - but preferably with a drink in hand.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_157.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_157.text: Many died so that we could see this day. They deserve to be honoured.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_84.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_84.text: But first, we revel and rest.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_195.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_195.text: Whatever the next step, the path will still be there come morn. There is no harm in taking a moment to honour the fallen. Then, quite honestly - to sleep.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_183.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_183.text: So many have fallen, on both sides of this conflict. Once, I would have died proudly in defence of the Netherbrain, thinking it a god.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_264.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_264.text: It is a sobering thought, and I intend to chase it away with whatever filth passes for wine in these parts.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_66.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_66.text: There are fallen to honour, as well. So many that we may never learn all of their names - but that is no reason not to try.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_237.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_237.text: Whatever our next step, we each have our own path to forge. Mine stranger than I ever believed possible - and yet, possible.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_237.context: NodeContext: Reflecting on how weird it is to be a mind flayer - yet glad she's alive at all.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_22.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_22.text: I never thought I'd be sorry to see a mind flayer go, yet here we are. Be safe.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_22.context: NodeContext: Bidding farewell (Arc: SH rejected Shar)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_68.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_68.text: I never thought I'd be sorry to see a mind flayer go, yet here we are. Lady Shar be with you.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_68.context: NodeContext: Bidding farewell (Arc: SH is loyal to Shar)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_52.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_52.text: Walk safely into the dark. You were truly tentacular.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_209.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_209.text: I hope the nights and shadows treat you well. You're an odd friend. But, I suppose, a friend still.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_44.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_44.text: I can't believe I'm about to say this, but - part of me will miss you.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_257.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_257.text: You're right of course. But, well... I'll miss you, friend. Your companionship has been quite the education.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_64.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_64.text: I could scarcely have imagined a mind flayer as an ally or a friend once... but I shall miss you.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_263.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_263.text: We were never bosom friends, illithid - but I owe you a debt. Be well.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_263.context: NodeContext: Grudging respect for a monstrous illithid who helped save us all

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_160.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_160.text: No, Boo, I will not miss the illithid. That is but manful sweat in my eye!
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_160.context: NodeContext: Defensively hissed to Boo as the Emperor bids it final farewell.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_6.text: If Baldur's Gate is too foolish to recognise its saviours, so be it. The city will miss your influence, as will I.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_98.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_98.text: I hope you are wrong, my friend.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_181.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_181.text: Yes. The city must be rebuilt. Lady Shar's church needs fertile ground in which to flourish... and in the meanwhile, there will be plenty of lost souls drawn to her embrace...

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_124.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_124.text: Not just the city - imagine the swathe of destruction the Absolute's armies will have caused.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_60.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_60.text: You're joking. After everything we've been through, you expect me to do manual labour?

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_207.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_207.text: After everything, that's your suggestion? Aren't you tired? I'm tired.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_125.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_125.text: Yes. Baldur's Gate will rise ever stronger. Let us be the ones to lay the first bricks.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_128.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_128.text: Perhaps we can circle back to that one, once the fires have died and the rubble's settled. I do think we deserve a little rest.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_151.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_151.text: Perhaps. But I fear it would take an entirely fresh start to mend the ills of this place...

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_197.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_197.text: I'll wager I can find a few helping hands. My children have not grown too old for chores.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_154.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_154.text: Minsc has flattened parts of the city before. The masons, they seem to prefer he stand and watch.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_208.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_208.text: Why bother? Let Baldur's Gate wear its scars proudly, until the next crisis wipes it from the world entirely.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_220.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_220.text: I may not be as strong as I used to be, but I'll be much better at advising the project.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_250.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_250.text: Let's get out of this godsforsaken city. I hear Amn is lovely this time of year.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_61.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_61.text: Amn? A keen idea - I was taught its Cloud Peaks are infested with monsters of all sorts. But first, fresh meat and a hot fire.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_192.speaker: The Emperor
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_192.text: Then this is where we part ways. I have business to attend to here. And a life to rebuild.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_127.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_127.text: My destiny lies in this city, with Lady Shar's church. They look to me now.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_218.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_218.text: What's the rush? Surely we're due to be feted as heroes in this place. We'll drink for free if any taverns survived.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_184.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_184.text: Why stop at Amn? There's a whole world out there - we just have to take it.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_201.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_201.text: It would be good to travel. It's been so long, kidnappings aside.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_216.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_216.text: Baldur's Gate burns, and its people tremble. I can't yet turn my back - not while the city's wounds still bleed.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_168.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_168.text: Truly? I don't know how you could even contemplate taking to the road after the journey we've been on.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_253.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_253.text: I assume you will not be surprised to learn I long to escape the city. I miss silence, greenery...

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_136.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_136.text: Last time I was there, I was poisoned near to death. Still, a little more restful than this place.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_136.context: NodeContext: Appraising our idea to go to Amn

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_146.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_146.text: That city is a sizzling boil of corruption, with fiends 'round every corner. Boo cannot wait!
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_146.context: NodeContext: Starts out glowering, but ends actually excited about returning to the action.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_106.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_106.text: Why leave? Baldur's Gate will be desperate for new leadership, and who better than us to lend our assistance.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_78.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_78.text: I wouldn't mind paying Amn a visit. Never been that far south, myself.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_142.speaker: Player
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_142.text: I think it's time we part ways.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_23.speaker: Shadowheart
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_23.text: I suppose our band wasn't meant to last forever... fate thrust us together, now it pulls us apart again.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_231.speaker: Lae'zel
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_231.text: I have fought many great battles by your side - I long for many more. I hope you reconsider.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_12.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_12.text: True, we have served our respective purposes. We're free to go wherever we wish.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_256.speaker: Astarion
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_256.text: Oh, you can't mean that. After all this?
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_256.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Reaction to suggestion of the party going its seperate ways

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_86.speaker: Wyll
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_86.text: Is this our final parting then? Please, reconsider. Alone, you are a storm. But together, we are a tempest.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_20.speaker: Gale
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_20.text: I won't lie. I'll miss our group. Hells, I'll even miss sleeping rough in the wilderness, to an extent.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_262.speaker: Halsin
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_262.text: It was always destined to be so, if we prevailed. But the foreknowledge makes it no less bittersweet...

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_63.speaker: Jaheira
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_63.text: For a time, at least. Time has taught me not to traffic in farewells - they are rarely so final as you might think.
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_63.context: NodeContext: Shrugging at player suggesting party go their separate ways, knowing smile. (Yes, very on the nose about a returning canon character)

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_255.speaker: Minsc
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_255.text: You would be parted from Boo so soon? Before he has even given his victory speech?
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_255.context: NodeContext: Reacting to player suggesting parting ways after defeating the Brain

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_56.text: I had hoped we would not part so quickly. I have no home, and few friends remaining in this world.

CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_223.speaker: Karlach
CombatOver_Nested_WhatNext_223.text: So soon? How strange. I thought our bond was... I don't know. Formidable.
